loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Nambale, a town near Kakamega County. Kakamega County is located in western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old-growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Peter is married and has eight children.  Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for twelve years now, and they are currently keeping dairy cattle, poultry, and fish. 

Peter is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income from the sale of honey and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Peter's first loan with Honey Care. He plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. Peter's hope for the future is to construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 21 años de edad, el vive con su madre y sus hermanos, Carlos reside en el  en el campo y se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de ganado en una pequeña hacienda y al jornal de trabajos de agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de toretes que los va a poner en la hacienda donde cuida el ganado y ahí mismo le hacen tener sus toretes y no lo cobran por la hierba, la aspiración de Carlos es seguir trabajando y quedarse viviendo en Ecuador ya que su madre es una señora colombiana.
texts.en: Carlos is 21 years old and lives with his mother and his brothers and sisters. He lives in the country and works as a farm worker, taking care of the cattle and tilling the land. He will use the loan to buy young bulls to put to graze on the farm where he works, since the owner generously offered to let them graze for free. Carlos's goal is to keep working and living in Ecuador. His mother is from Colombia.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Nyongesa's Group

texts.en:
Nyongesa is 66-years-old and is often referred to as a really hardworking individual. As a group leader, he is representing his group in Webuye District, formed by 11 farmers, including himself.

Nyongesa has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and has worked with One Acre Fund for a while now, having joined for the first time in 2014 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Not only will he get maize seeds and fertilizer with his loan, but also a solar light in order to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. He decided that he will use the profits he gains from this year’s harvest to send his children to school.

With this loan, Nyongesa’s Group will receive a total of 9 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a smallholder dairy farmer from the village of Bogichora, whose best friend is the only dairy cow on his farm. His family consists of his wife and 6 children aged between 12 years and 24 years. This humble family stays on a half acre of farmland situated near a river, from which they fetch water for both domestic and commercial use.

Joshua is appealing to lenders from all over the world to assist him with a KES 20,000 loan to purchase several heads of poultry. His intention is to diversify his farm by introducing poultry farming for egg and meat production. The produce from the poultry farm will not only improve their diet but will also bring extra income necessary for the family to meet its basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 48-year-old married woman from Leyte, Philippines. She operates a small sari-sari (retail store) business, selling various goods and food items to the people in her place. This has been her source of income for the past 18 years. Her husband is a carpenter.

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell, like canned canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, toiletries, condiments, and others. With this loan, she will be able to improve her range of merchandise, which will attract more buyers.

Victoria hopes to expand her store in the future so that she will be able to cater to more buyers and customers.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, beverages, biscuits, snack foods, shampoo, toiletries, condiments, and others

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is 43-years-old and married with eight dependents. Nelia and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for 24 years now. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy an engine, fishing weights, fishing nets, nylon, floaters and bamboo. This will assure her of continuous fishing and a better income in the future when her equipment is new and of good quality. Her profit will then be used for savings, healthy meals for her children and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy an engine, fishing weights, fishing nets, nylon, floaters and bamboo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quintals of sweetcorn and lime.

loans.name: Orias

texts.en:
Orias is a 49-year-old man and is married to Emeranci, 30-years-old. They have three children: Rian, 5; Benji, 3; and Abi, 2 months.

Orias spends his days cultivating plants at the farm. He cultivates string beans, mustard greens, tomatoes and corn. Orias usually sells them at the small kiosk in front of his house. The income from selling the harvest was spent to cover their household and saving for educational expenses. 

Orias plans to cultivate more plants; therefore, he needs more capital to do so. Orias then submitted a loan application and requested a loan of IDR 3,000,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer as well.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 41 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el Distrito de Buenos Aires, desde hace más de 20 años. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Adriana es a la compra y venta de aves de corral y animales menores (patos, cuyes, pollos, pavos, entre otros), como es ganado ovino y porcino, Adriana cuenta con experiencia en el negocio además de ser conocida en la zona y contar con clientela fija. Adriana cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona donde vive, y su cónyugue se dedica a la agricultura. El destino del crédito será para mejora de su vivienda pues necesita arreglar el techo de su vienvienda porque ya se acercan la temporada de lluvias y ella desea brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Lo que a su vez le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Adriana is 41 years old and lives with her partner. She has lived in the district of Buenos Aires for more than 20 years. Life in the community is calm and tranquil because the people work in commerce and raise small livestock. The community is located in the district of Buenos Aires, Morropón province, in the region of Piura, on the north coast of Peru.

Adriana's business is buying and selling domestic fowl and small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, turkeys, among others), and also sheep and pigs. Adriana has experience in the business, is known in the area, and has a steady clientele. She has good personal and work references in the area where she lives. Her husband works in agriculture. The loan will be used to improve her house because she needs to fix the roof. The rainy season is coming and she wants provide safety and comfort for her family. This will also allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her house by fixing her roof.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rema works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Rema is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell to customers.

Rema has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Urwego Group

texts.fr:
M. Florence  fait partie du groupe  Urwego  et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a 40 ans et est mariée à Pie un agent de la Régie des eaux et d’électricité du Burundi. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 18 à 25 ans, dont 4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du charbon de bois, de la bière industrielle (primus et  amstel), et de la  limonade depuis 10 ans. 

Elle est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de caisses de bière Primus et de sacs de charbon de bois à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait acheter un terrain et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Miss Florence is part of the Urwego group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and is married to Pie, an agent at the water and electric company of Burundi. Together, they have five children, aged 18-25 years, four of whom attend school. 

She has been selling charcoal, mass-produced beer (Primus and Amstel), and lemon soda for ten years. 

She is on her fourth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she gets, she is going to augment her capital and buy a lot of cases of Primus beer and a lot of sacks of charcoal to sell and earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy land and to see her children attend school.

loans.use: to augment her capital and buy a lot of cases of Primus beer and a lot of sacks of charcoal to sell and earn more.

loans.name: Eid

texts.en:
Eid is a 22-year-old single man. He is a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians, especially those who live in camps, he opened a small cafe shop inside the camp to help cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Eid is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to improve his family's living conditions by renovating his house to make it a healthier place for his family.

Eid hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and save some profit for his future.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número  12°. Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde  7 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mariana, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, donde ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas que hace está luchando por mejorar. Ella comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas varias para la venta.
texts.en:
The group named “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) is in its 12th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that seven members are below the poverty line.

One of the members is Sra. Mariana. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 2 poverty level. Through her effort and by continuing her work of selling clothes, she is striving to improve. Mariana says that her work requires a great deal of sacrifice, but she does it in order to help her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes that she can sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 46-year-old married woman with five children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs and selling rice in the Philippines. Rosario requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosario has been raising pigs for six years. She has borrowed 5 times from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the renovation of their house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Naomi and Alheri.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Emmanuel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y a la agricultura desde hace 4 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto y asi continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The borrower's face is blurred because he is 21 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for four years. He sells his products in the area where he lives. He lives with his family in a house of their own. This young man asks for a loan to buy cattle for regrazing in order to keep working and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy cattle for regrazing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 1 año a la venta de licuados de fruta, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y con lo que gana puede salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas por mayor, leche, azucar, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man, age 28, has his face pixelated because he lives in a high-risk area. He has been selling fruit smoothies for one year. His business is located in his home and his earnings help him to get ahead. The borrower lives at his parents’ house.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fruit in bulk, milk, sugar, and other supplies so that he can continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk, milk, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru:
Мухабат 39-летняя жительница городка Дангара, где живет вместе с мужем и двумя сыновьями. Ее муж предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов, старший сын студент, а младший еще учится в школе. 
Мухабат очень способная и трудолюбивая женщина. На протяжении 6 лет она шьет женские таджикские платья, а также курпа и курпача (ватные стеганые одеяла и матрасы). Ее услуга всегда востребована и она относится к своей профессии с интересом и любовью. Мухабат в данный момент собирается расширить деятельность. Она на сумму кредита хочет купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, а также необходимое количество тканей для шитья. Она очень надеется на этот кредит, который поможет ей увеличить доходность бизнеса и улучшить финансовое положение ее семьи.
texts.en:
Muhabat is a 39-year-old resident of the town of Dangara, where she lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband works as a contractor doing home renovations, her oldest son is a university student and her youngest is still in grade school.

Muhabat is a very capable and hardworking woman. For the past six years she has been sewing women's dresses in the national style as well as "kurpas" and "kurpachas", local types of quilted bedding and mattresses. Her services are always in need and she approaches her profession with interest and passion. 

Muhabat is currently planning to expand her business. With the loan amount she wants to purchase a new, modern sewing machine as well as the necessary amount of fabric for sewing. She hopes very much for this loan, which will help her increase her business revenue and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is 23 years old. He is married with two children between the ages of six months and two years. They do not yet go to school. Innocent is a motorcyclist and has been driving for five years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle for transport. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Elsa Digna María

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Digna, tiene 70 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen diez hijos mayores de edad, varios de ellos viven cerca de su casa pero ya independientes. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Digna es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene un taller de ebanistería, allí el junto a dos de sus hijos elaboran puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, trabaja a base de pedidos de sus clientes que le piden que les realice sus obras, en ocasiones también entregan en mueblerías de la ciudad, el lleva más de 30 años con su taller.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera, pinturas, lijas y otros materiales para elaborar los muebles. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son que su familia siempre tenga trabajo y buena salud para que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Credit, Union, and Strength Group gets together every two weeks in the La Dolorosa neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are heavily visited all year round and for being a city whose beauty is unmatched, having many tourist attractions. 

Here lives Digna, a 70-year-old woman who is married and with her husband has ten adult children, several of whom live near her house but are independent. Her husband is an artisan. Digna is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband, is taking out the loan for her husband to use in his work. He has a cabinetmaking workshop, and there he and two of his children make doors, beds, and furniture of all kinds and models. He works based on his clients' orders--they ask him to build them things. They also sometimes deliver furniture to furniture stores in the city. He has had his workshop for over 30 years. 

He will use this loan to buy wood, paint, sandpaper, and other materials for making furniture. Digna has been in the Credit Group since the beginning, and she likes it because, with the loans, they get ahead. Her dreams are for her family to always have work and good health so that they never need for anything.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sandpaper, and other materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Kertz

texts.en:
Kertz is 27 years old, married, and has one child. He has been operating his grocery store for over two years and was able to sustain the business with the help of his wife. He supported his family and bought some home improvements for a comfortable living.

He is now aiming for an increase of sales, so he took a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to his inventory capital. He hopes to cater to the needs of his customers and increase his income as well.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell

loans.name: Clare's Group

texts.en:
Clare's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Clare, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 25 years old, is married, and has one child. Clare has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Clare isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Clare will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Clare's Group will purchase a total of 5 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Avegil

texts.en:
Avegil is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She engages in a buy-and-sell type business. She has a stall situated inside a market, selling various sizes and colors of footwear like slippers. She is a 28-year-old married woman and has a 2-year-old son. She has been in this kind of business for ten years now. 

Avegil requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase assorted stocks and dry goods. This will attract more customers and give them a wide variety to choose from. In this way, Avegil can provide a healthy diet and better living conditions. She hopes to have a stable income that would help support the needs of her growing child.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stocks and dry goods.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 50-year-old woman. She is from Carles, Iloilo.  She works in fishing together with her husband. 

For three decades, Lilia has operated the fishing business in order to provide for her six children ages six to thirty. This is the most common livelihood in Carles that most women like Lilia are engaged in. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wood, fishing nets and nylon. Lilia hopes that with an improved business profits, her children can have a good education and a good life in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, fishing nets, and nylon

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora has been operating her retail store for many years and was able to sustain the business. She supported her family and financed home renovation to create a safe environment. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for the business. She is now aiming to increase sales and is taking a new loan to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her usual inventory. She hopes to expand her store by making some renovation for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase grains and livestock feeding supplies to sell in addition to her usual inventory.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Adelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelina has been farming rice for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 54 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as spices, snack foods, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Para Orlando no ha sido nada fácil sacar adelante su negocio el cual le heredo su familia y que hoy a sus 26 años de edad busca alternativas para generar recursos. 
Buscando consejos sabios, de campesinos exitosos le dieron un consejo para su producción de leche y concluyo que quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de un toro para poder preñar las vacas, pues para los que no saben las vacas solo dan leche al estar preñadas.
Este crédito le ahorrara a futuro todo el proceso de inseminación artificial que es muy costoso y seguirá trabajando para honrar el negocio de su familia dándole prosperidad y rentabilidad
texts.en:
For Orlando it hasn’t been easy to get his business through. He inherited it from his family and now at his 26 years of age is looking for alternatives to generate resources. 

Asking for wise advices, successful farmers gave him some advices regarding his milk production and he concluded that he wants to ask for a loan in order to buy a bull to impregnate the cows. For the people that don’t know, cows only give milk when they are pregnant. 

This loan will save him from the whole process of artificial insemination in the future, since it is a costly procedure, and will allow him to continue working to honor the family’s business by making it prosperous and profitable.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Liman

texts.en:
Liman is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Liman joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Aminu, Yahaya and Tasuu.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Liman would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Liman can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Liman  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yokubjon

texts.ru: Ёкубжон мужчина 30 лет. Женат. У Ёкубжона 1 ребёнок. Ёкубжон проживает со своей семьёй вместе со своими родителями. "Так приятно у мусульман, не оставлять родителей. Родители посветили всю свою жизнь на наше воспитание" говорит он. Ёкубжон является кормильцем семьи. Жена Ёкубжона домохозяйка занимается воспитанием своего ребёнка и ведёт хозяйство по дому. Из-за материальной нехватки в семье Ёкубжон после окончания средней школы не смог поступить В ВУЗ. И он начал заниматься сельхоз культурой. В один день он собрался с друзьями, чтоб посидеть. И его друг Бобур рассказал ему о своей деятельности. Как он получает доход от корма КРМ с последующей продажей. Это идея заинтересовала Ёкубжона. От прибыли сельхозкультуры Ёкубжон купил 2 голов МРС. На данный момент он откармливает их. В осенний период стоимость крупно рогатого скота снижается. По этому он хочет воспользоваться сезоном закупить МРС, чтоб реализовать свой план. Ёкубжону нужны на это денежные средства. Ёкубжон обратился в организацию Арванд за помощью. И очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Yokubjon is a 30-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He lives with his family and his parents. He says: "This is common among Muslims, not to leave their parents, as they dedicated their whole lives to raising us." He is the breadwinner for his family; his wife is a homemaker and raises their child and manages the home and farm.

For financial reasons, Yokubjon was unable to enter university after graduating from high school, so he started to work in agriculture. One day, he was spending time with his friends and his friend Bobur told him about his business fattening and reselling livestock. This idea interested Yokubjon and he used his income from agriculture to purchase two animals. At the moment he is fattening them. In the fall, the price of small livestock goes down, and therefore he wants to take advantage of the season to buy more animals and achieve his goals. He needs money for this and so has turned to Arvand for help. He hopes very much for support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en:
Rabiu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, he is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like clothing and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sa'adu

texts.en:
Sa'adu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Micha, Jamila and Misbahu.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sa'adu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Sa'adu  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en:
Maryamu is a maize farmer from Nagona village in Kaduna state. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Maryamu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Maryamu can now store her maize at harvest time.  She can sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Maryamu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland.  She hopes to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, reducing the pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, el se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería desde hace 10 años vende de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su hijo logran salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de billetes de lotería por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Santos is 64 years old and lives in his own house with his son, who works and helps him economically. For the last ten years, he has made a living selling lottery tickets. He sells itinerantly through the different markets. With what he makes from his work and the help of his son, they manage to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to purchase lottery tickets wholesale, in order to continue his work and thus have higher income.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets wholesale.

loans.name: Cinthia Beatriz

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de tres años de edad, vive en  la casa de sus padres. Ella estudia trabajo social en una universidad local.
Doña Cinthia  pensando en un futuro mejor para ella y su hijo estudia y trabaja, ella en sociedad con su papá tienen un taller de aluminio y vidrio, su papá realiza todo tipo de trabajos en aluminio y vidrio como puertas, ventanas y varias cosas más, mientras él trabaja en el taller ella se encarga de llevar la parte contable, los cobros y la compra de materiales entre otras cosas, el papá lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad y ella empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo 
Este crédito es para comprar aluminio y vidrio para realizar los trabajos. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Unión y Fortaleza [Unity & Strength] credit group meets every 15 days in the Dolorosa neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are busy all year long, and for being a city without equal in its beauty, with many tourist attractions.

Cinthia, a 23-year-old single mother with a 3-year-old son, lives in Manta with her parents. She is studying social work at the local college.

Dreaming of a better future for herself and her son, Cinthia studies and works. In partnership with her dad, she runs an aluminum and glass workshop. Her dad makes all kinds of products out of aluminum and glass, such as doors, windows, and various other items. While he works in the shop, she takes care of the accounts: their sales and their supply purchases, among other things.

Her dad has been doing this for more than 15 years, and she started after her credit group received their first loan.

This loan is to purchase aluminum and glass to complete their orders. She has been part of her credit group for 5 loan cycles, and she likes it because of the assistance that it gives the members. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum and glass

loans.name: Jesus Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jesus Del Carmen tiene 39 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su cónyuge en el caserío San jacinto Km 83 distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el caserío se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jesus Del Carmen es la crianza y comercio de animales menores, tales como patos, conejos, cerdos, entre otros. La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 5 años, en el caserío y anexos. El destino del crédito será para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. Jesus Del Carmen comprará materiales de construcción como es ladrillo, cemento fierro etc. para construir una habitación más en su domicilio. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto es muy comercial en la zona. Jesus del Carmen piensa trabajar otorgando buen servicio en base a un buen producto, e incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jesus del Carmen is 39 years old; he is married, has two young children, lives in his own home with his partner in the town of San Jacinto, 83 km from the district of La Matanza.  Live in the town is quiet because as far as the business activities of the inhabitants are concerned, they work in farming, ranching, and animal breeding.  His community is located in the district of La Matanza in Morropón Province, Piura Region, on Peru's northern coast. 

Jesus del Carmen works raising and selling small animals, such as ducks, rabbits, pigs, and others.  He has had this business for over five years in his town and the neighboring areas.  This loan will be used to make improvements to his home.  Jesus del Carmen will buy construction materials, such as brick, cement, rebar, etc. to build another room in his home.  The market is showing good prospects because his product is heavily traded in the area.  Jesus del Carmen plans to work, offering good service to promote a good product, and to increase his sales.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home; to build another room in his home.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy additional hogs and feed which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve more her business if you will let her borrow again an amount of 45,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of feed and hogs which will increase her profit. An increase in profit will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Mary Ann wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and additional hogs.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is the mother of one, and she is a laborer at the same workplace as her husband. It is hard for them to get by on their minimum wages. 

Believing in the need to do extra work, she began to sell Ersag products. She sells organic products such as toothpaste and vitamins. She works through a members-only group and supports the other women in the group.  Thus when she does her job well, she provides jobs for others as well.

With this loan she will buy more Ersag products. 

Her son is a university student living at home. Seda wants to earn a large income and become a homeowner.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Seda Hanım tek çocuklu,eşi bir yerde işçi olarak çalışmakta.  Askari ücretle geçinmeleri zor.  Ek iş yapmanın gereğine inanarak,Ersağ ürünleri satmaya başlamıştır.  Organik ürünler satıyor.  Diş macunu,organik vitaminler v.s.  İşini iyi yaptığı gibi,başkalarına da iş sağlıyor.  Üyelik sistemi ile çalışıyorlar.  Diğer kadınlarada destek veriyor. Aldığı bu kredi ile ürün alacak.  Çocuğu okuyor.  Ailesinin evinde yaşıyor.  Çok para kazanıp,ev sahibi olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more products like toothpaste and vitamins to sell

loans.name: Mukaila

texts.en:
Mukaila is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mukaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mukaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Mukaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to be one of the most profitable farmers in Dogon Juri.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married, with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling livestock in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more livestock to sell. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell.

loans.name: Elisha

texts.en:
Elisha is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Elisha joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: John, Yosi and Dokas.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Elisha would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Elisha can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Elisha  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To meet expenses like child school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Koe Pyta Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Koe Pyta, es un grupo muy unido y antiguo con 17 integrantes, se encuentra en el 6to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, manifiestan agradecimiento por la ayuda y las constantes capacitaciones.
 Se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Vicenta por su personalidad activa y espíritu emprendedor que cada día va acrecentando.
Ella tiene su huerta, en un principio solo tenía una huertita pequeña y hoy día ya cuenta una plantación de mandioca y sandia. Es quien guía a sus compañeras de este grupo para seguir con el mismo desempeño y lograr muchos beneficios a través del trabajo unido, cooperativo y solidario.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas, abono y demás productos para usar en su plantación, de manera que podrá seguir siendo un ejemplo de lucha y sacrificio.
texts.en:
The committee named “Koe Pyta” is a unified and well-established group that has 17 members. They are participating in their sixth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. In addition, they express their appreciation for the assistance and the continuous training.

One of the members who should be mentioned is Sra. Vicenta. Her lively personality and enterprising spirit help her to grow each day. She had a garden that was very small at the beginning, but today it has been transformed into a farm where she grows cassava and watermelons. Vicenta has been a guide to her fellow group members, showing them that they can continue in their development and reap the benefits of working together in a cooperative and supportive manner.

Vicenta is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies that she will use on her farm. She continues to be an example of determination and self-sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and other supplies for her farm.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 21 years. She is a future-oriented woman at her age. 

She has engaged in the fishing business for two years now. This usually earns her PHP 9,000 per month. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy an engine, fishing nets, nylon, floaters, rope, and bamboo for her boat. 

Lory dreams of seeing her business more successful in the future so she can help her parents and save for her future.

Any income generated will also be used to reinvest in the same business, to buy food for herself and her parents, and to pay the household bills.

loans.use: to buy an engine, fishing nets, nylon, floaters, rope, and bamboo for her boat

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de pan dulce desde hace varios años vende en su moto por las diferentes colonias, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pan dulce y darle mantenimiento a la moto ya que esa es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 32 years old. He owns his own house, where he lives with his partner and their child.

For many years, he has made a living selling sweet bread. He sells it from his motorcycle, in the various neighborhoods nearby.

He is requesting this loan to purchase more sweet bread and to maintain his motorcycle. This is his only source of work, and with this loan, he will have a better level of income.

loans.use: to purchase more sweet bread and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es: Edwin de 35 años de edad se dedica desde hace 10 años a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de maíz y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su madre, su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, Edwin está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 35 years old. For the past 10 years, he has made his living by farming, mainly growing corn and leafy vegetables. He sells his products in the various markets near his house.

He lives with his mother, his wife, and their two children in their family home.

Edwin is requesting this loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, plague control, etc. and to improve the plot shown in the photo, so that he can continue working and earn a better income.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, compost, plague control, etc. and to improve the soil

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sugarcane farming and pig fattening businesses. Delia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell in her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past sixteen loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is single, and she has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elisa has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ma. Elisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Shanie Lou

texts.en:
Shanie Lou is 38 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has an internet café business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy computer supplies for her business.

Shanie Lou has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies for her business

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine, a successful businesswoman, was very pleased with her first Kiva loan and hopes to be supported a second time. She is 31 years old and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region with her husband and 3-year-old daughter.  

After finishing high school, Karine graduated with a major in law from the Russian State University of Trade and Economics in Piatigorsk, Russia. Karine started her own business in 2010. She rented some space and opened her own small law office, where she continues to work today. Karine works very hard and without holidays and, as she says, she already has great fame in her city and a lot of new clients. Karine’s husband is now in the Russian Federation and from there he sends money to his family.

Karine is requesting a loan of 500,000 AMD as she has decided to do some cosmetic repairs to her rented office, since it is often visited and she wants it to look stylish and modern.

loans.use: to repair and update her rented office space.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Perder un ser querido es algo que un ser nunca estará preparado y más si es tu esposo una persona con la que has compartido no solo un vínculo matrimonial si no múltiples sucesos etc. 
Libia una mujer de 49 años paso por este trágico hecho del cual fue muy difícil levantarse, quedo a cargo de 4 hijos y de un negocio que tenía experiencia en los que se hace mas no sabía administrarlo.
Libia sabía que tenía que mostrar firmeza y por ello inicio a trabajar fuertemente en el negocio y ahora busca mejorar sus ventas, incrementar su utilidad, y demostrar todo lo que aprendió de su padre quien le enseño todo el oficio.
Para ejecutar este pensado necesita capital que no tiene por lo que solicita un crédito para la compra de abonos, riegos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, fungicidas. Ayuda a esta mujer a mejorar su negocio, el cual no ha sido fácil de levantar ante la usencia de su marido.
texts.en:
Losing a loved one is something for which you are never prepared, and more so if it is your spouse, a person with whom you have shared not only a marital bond but also multiple events, etc. 

Libia, a 49-year-old woman, experienced that tragic event and it was very hard to pick herself up from it. She was left to care for four children and a business in which she had experience in the day-to-day but she did not know how to administer it. Libia knew that she had to show strength, and that is why she began to work hard at the business and now she seeks to improve her sales, increase her profits, and demonstrate everything that she learned from her father, who taught her the entire trade.

In order to do this, she needs capital that she does not have, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase manure, irrigation, fertilizer, pesticide, and fungicide. Help this woman improve her business, which has not been easy to pick up given the absence of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase manure, irrigation, fertilizer, pesticide, and fungicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct proper dairy facilities for his herd

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a 62-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Simon has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Simon described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, in addition to fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, Simon’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from Makera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Dauda, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Doña Isabel se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel sells clothing as a street vendor at different markets near her house. She has many established customers because of the quality of the clothes and the good prices. Isabel lives in her own home along with her family.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing in bulk so that she can continue her sales and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk that she can sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su nieta, el se dedica desde hace carios años a la crianza de ganado de repasto, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde reside, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de terneros para engordar y asi continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 59 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and granddaughter. For several years he has made a living raising grazing cattle. He markets his products in the areas surrounding where he lives. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase calves to fatten and thus continue his work, which generates good earnings for him.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 64 years old and resides in Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has eight grown children.

She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish, crabs, and clams to earn a living.  She has been in this kind of business for more than 20 years. 

Letecia has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fishing materials like weights, fishing hooks, fuel for her motorboat and foam for fish storage. 

This is a big help in her day-to-day livelihood, improving her ongoing catch and providing tools essential in fishing. 

 Letecia is trying her best to handle her fishing business  to be stable in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like weights, fishing hooks, fuel for her motorboat and foam for fish storage

loans.name: K. K. M Group

texts.en:
Somoe, who is in her late 30s, is single with three children who are still in school. She has been selling fish for two years now. She works from 8:00 am to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Somoe's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more fish and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning a shop for selling soft drinks at retail and wholesale. 

Somoe will share this loan with her loan group, K. K. M, which consist of eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a fisherman from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is 42 years old, but he started fishing when he was only 12. Fishing has been his source of income since then. 

In addition to fishing, he also keep a "motorcycle-for-hire" business. He is married with four dependents ages three to eighteen. 

Joel is asking for a loan to buy a boat hull, fishing nets, and an engine. With this, he can expand and improve his fishing ventures to increase his catch and his income. In the future, Joel hopes to make his business a success so his children can finish their education.

loans.use: to buy a boat hull, fishing nets, and an engine

loans.name: Héctor Antonio

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Héctor, tiene 43 años de edad, está separado y de esta relación tuvo 1 hijo de 17 años el cual estudia en colegio y  vive con la mamá pero aun depende de él. 
El señor Héctor  es un hombre que le gusta trabajar para salir adelante y darle lo necesario a su hijo, el se dedica a realizar trabajos de plomería y cerrajería en varios los lugares, tiene contratos con personas particulares y con instituciones en las cuales le dan el mantenimiento, aunque lo que más ganancia de deja son las construcciones de viviendas donde realiza todas las instalaciones, lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar herramientas y  materiales de plomería que necesita para realizar su labor. Lleva 4 años en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Unión y Fortaleza [Unity & Strength] credit group meets every 15 days in the Dolorosa neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are busy all year long, and for being a city without equal in its beauty, with many tourist attractions.

Héctor lives in Manta. He is 43 years old and separated. He has a 17-year-old son from that relationship, who is in secondary school. He lives with his mother but still depends on Héctor financially.

Héctor is a man who likes to work to move forward in life and provide for his son. He works as a plumber and locksmith at various sites. He has contracts with individuals and institutions where he provides maintenance long-term. However, he makes most of his money through installations in newly constructed buildings. He has been doing this for over 15 years, and it is how he makes a living.

This loan is to purchase tools and supplies that he needs to complete his jobs. He has been part of his credit group for 4 years, and he likes it because of the assistance that it gives the members. His dream is to continue moving forward in life.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools and supplies

loans.name: Santa Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Santa, tiene 65 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Santa es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace todo lo posible para que a su familia no les falte nada y aun mas después de la muerte de su querido esposo, ella tiene un deposito  en su casa donde vende agua, colas, yogurt, pony malta y varias bebidas mas, son muchas las personas que llegan todos los días a comprar sus productos ya sea al por mayor o al menudeo. Lleva más de 10  años con este negocio con  el cual se gana lo suficiente para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar agua, colas, yogurt y otras bebidas que ella vende. Esta desde el inicio  en este Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Unión Y Fortaleza credit group meets every 2 weeks in the La Dolorosa neighborhood in the city of Manta. This city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are frequented during the entire year, and for being a city of unequaled beauty with a lot of tourist attractions.

Santa, 65 years of age, lives in this place. A few years ago, her husband passed away and she became a widow. From this relationship, she has four adult children, two of whom still live with her.

Santa is a very hardworking woman who does everything she can so that her family does not lack anything, and even more since the death of her beloved husband.

She has a stand in her house where she sells water, colas, yogurt, a malt beverage, and various other drinks. There are a lot of people who come everyday to buy her products, whether wholesale or retail. She has had this business for more than 10 years. With it, she earns enough to get ahead with her family.

She is going to use this loan to buy water, colas, yogurt and other beverages that she sells. She has been with this credit group from the beginning, and she likes it for the assistance that the loans provide. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy water, colas, yogurt, and other drinks.

loans.name: Marius

texts.en:
Farming, also called agriculture or husbandry, is the cultivation of animals and plants for food and other products used to sustain life. Agriculture continues to dominate Kenya’s economy, and is also the largest contributor to Kenya’s gross domestic product.

Marius, 25, started farming approximately six years ago, and although he began farming as a hobby, it eventually became his career. His half-acre of land is located in the Kebulonik, Eldoret area of Kenya. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops.

He sells milk and farm produce to his neighbors and to the local market, but he has been facing one big problem: timely delivery of the products to the market. Kebulonik is located in a very remote area that has a poor road network and the terrain is very bad. The only mode of transport is boda boda (motorbike). He is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that would solve his transportation problem. 

This loan will be of great help because it will allow Marius to transport his farm products to the market and deliver them in a timely manner. Milk and vegetables are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch high prices. Through the loan, Marius will not be worried because he will always deliver the products on time and gain more profits. This motorbike will be reliable for quick transportation for both long and short distances. Through the motorbike, Marius' life is going to change and his standards of living are going to improve.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie is 40 years old and married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Roselie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 36 years old. She is married with four children aged between 2 and 10 years, three of whom go to school. 

She has a shop and has been in a business for eight years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy vegetables,sweet bananas and soaps for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, sweet bananas, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 42 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Catherine requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy a larger stock of frozen foods to sell. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Catherine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ülkü

texts.en:
Ulku is a married mother of two university students. Her husband is sick, so she provides for her family with the money she earns working for the municipal government. Her backyard is a suitable place for a greenhouse. 

In her garden she grows vegetable seedlings and flowers. Her husband helps with sales. Thus she makes additional income. With the loan from Maya, Ulku will buy seeds. She is a very hard-working woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ülkü hanım,iki çocuklu.  Eşi hasta,kendisi aynı zamanda belediyede çalışmakta.  Kendisinin kazandığı ile ailenin geçimini sağlıyor.  İki çocuk ünversitede okuyor.  Evinin bahçesi seracılık için uygun biryer.  Evinin bahçesinde,sebze fidesi ve çiçek yetiştiriyor.  Eşi de satışına yardım ediyor.  Ek gelir elde ediyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile tohum alacak.  Ülkü Hanım çok çalışkan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's Group was formed by 11 farmers in the Webuye District and is being represented by Christine, who is the group leader, pictured above.  She is 43 years old, is married and has three children. Christine has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Christine is not new to One Acre Fund. She joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has earned more profit from each harvest since joining. This year, Christine will not only obtain fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition as she will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Christine's Group will purchase a total of seven solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Amos's Group

texts.en:
Amos's group is formed by 12 farmers in Webuye District and being represented by Amos, the group leader pictured above. He is 42 years old, is married, and has 3 children. Amos has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Amos isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  He actually joined the program in 2012. He has since noticed that his life has changed; especially that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, Amos will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition.  Now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Amos's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6 acres."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hassan joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Meshak, Obadiah and Keziya.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hassan spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to eventually ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses such as his children's school fees and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emmy's Group

texts.en:
Emmy is a 41-year-old proud mother of five children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of ten farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Emmy has noticed that she has learnt a lot from farming trainings.

Emmy described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Emmy’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land and purchase a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Shaaibu

texts.en:
Shaaibu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Shaaibu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ado, Hamza and Haruna. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shaaibu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shaaibu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Shaaibu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like child school fees and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for small-scale truck farming

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a farmer from Nyamira who is also invested in other personal businesses relating to agriculture, including transportation. He owns two acres of farmland where he keeps two cows and ten poultry birds. He has also grown more than 1,000 softwood trees on the farm. Edward bought a motorcycle to help him ferry his produce to the market. He also makes additional income transporting passengers and other goods over short distances. The income he generates from all these activities has enabled him to support his wife, Abigael, and his 4-year-old child who attends school.
 
Edward is seeking a loan to purchase a generator that will provide electricity to enhance his farm operations. Edward is one of the many rural smallholder farmers in Kenya who live in off-grid zones. He relies on solar-powered devices for lighting and charging the phone. The major problem he is facing in regards to energy is that solar power is heavily reliant on weather conditions. Nyamira is a rain-fed area where they could go days without clear skies. And, even during the clear skies, solar power is not sufficient for applications that require high power voltage. 

Your loan will transform Edward’s life by providing him with an alternative solution to the energy challenges he is facing. Judging by the number of trees he has planted, Edward is very conscious about the wellbeing of the environment. He will always pick environmental-friendly sources of energy. However, he also needs a source of energy that will give him high output from time to time. Your loan will help him solve exactly this problem

loans.use: to pay for a generator.

loans.name: Vanessa Geraldine

texts.es: Vanessa de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo quien trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 32 years old, lives in her own house with her two children and her husband, who works and helps them financially. She makes her living selling clothes as a mobile vendor in the different markets. She has many loyal customers for the quality of the clothes and her good prices.

She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes wholesale, in order to continue with her sales and so that she can get better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for small-scale truck farming.

loans.name: Miriam Azucena

texts.es: Miriam de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde desde hace 2 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para continuar con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old and lives in her family home with her three children.

For two years now, she has made a living by raising chickens. She sells her products in the various markets near her house.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chickens and chicken feed, so she can continue raising them and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donotha is 33 years old. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 15 years, all of whom go to school. 

She is a tailor and has been running a business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for tailoring for resale.

loans.name: Maurice's Group

texts.en:
Maurice, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Maurice will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also two solar lights. Receiving two solar lights as part of his loan means that now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Maurice plans to use the profits he gains this year to send his children to school.

In total, Maurice’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.en:
Anne Marie is 45 years old.  She is married with five children, ages between 7 and 18 years, all of them in school. 

She has a shop and has been in business for seven years. With the loan, she would buy cooking oil and soaps to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil and soaps to sell

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, she would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Saratu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Johnmark's Group

texts.en:
Johnmary is the 56-year-old proud father of eight children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Teso District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Johnmary has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.  Johnmary described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

He is very excited also to be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize.  He will now be able to reduce his consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Johnmary’s group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 15 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, con tres hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Margarita se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral(patos, cuyes, conejos, entre otros), desde hace 03 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de cuyes, patos, gallina, pavos; el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 41 years old and lives with her life partner along with three children in her care.  She lives in her own home in a rural area in the district of Oyotún, the Province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.  Her community work predominantly in agriculture, livestock and business.

Margarita works raising and selling penned animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, rabbits, and other animals.  She has been in this field for three years.  Her business is located at her home.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, turkeys, etc.  The loan will help her to make a larger investment.  This will thus help her grow her business and satisfy all the needs of her customers.  It will permit her to improve her income over the short turn, and thus increase her earnings and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase guinea pigs, ducks, rabbits, etc. for raising and selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for small-scale truck farming.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group, formed by 15 farmers in Teso District, Kenya. She is 56 years old and the married mother of six children. She is often described as a very reliable person. 

Although Jane has been a farmer for 10 years, she is new to One Acre Fund.  She decided to join this year because she really wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. 

Even though she is new to the program, Jane wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Jane hopes to be able to send her children to school.
