With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 13 solar lights, as, even though Jane decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Barau village in Kaduna state. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Saratu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland.  She hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing; reducing the pressure to sell her corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for small-scale truck farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Achat   des intrants pour le maraichage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for small-scale truck farming.

loans.name: Guiliana Aracely

texts.es:
Guiliana Aracely tiene 29 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Guiliana Aracely se dedica a las actividad de servicio de transporte urbano en su mototaxi, con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, ella brinda este servicio en su distrito y alrededores, Guiliana Aracely solicita préstamo para mantenimiento de su mototaxi, pues esto le asegurará el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Guiliana Aracely is 29 years old. She lives with her husband and their children in the Cayalti district. The residents earn a living from farming, trade and raising cattle, two hours from the Chiclayo city, on the northern coast of Peru.

Guiliana Aracely works in the business of urban transport services with her motorcycle taxi. With more than 3 years of experience in this business, she provides this service in her district and its surroundings. Guiliana Aracely is requesting this loan to maintain her motorcycle taxi since this will assure her proper performance from her work tool. In the short term this will improve her income, increase her earnings and in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to maintain her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Edward Miguel

texts.es:
Edward Miguel tiene 25 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de sus padres; vive en casa de familla de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Vista Florida; Edward Miguel es conviviente y tiene una hija de 8 meses de edad. Edward Miguel es nacidos en caserio vista florida distrito santo tomas, él se lleva bien con los mienbros de caserio y pobladores del distrito de santo; además cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Edward Miguel es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, cultiva café en caserio vista florida distrito santo tomas, actividad la realiza hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café porque anteriormente a cultivado variedad nacional y ahora cultiva catimor. Adicionalmente cría ganado bacuno, contando a la fecha con 4 reses de su propiedad, y también tiene cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Edward Miguel is 25 years old and lives in a stable home along with his parents.  He lives in the family house made of rustic material in a plot located in the neighborhood of Vista Florida.  Edward Miguel lives together with his life partner and they have an 8 month old daughter.  Edward Miguel was born in this same neighborhood and gets along well with his neighbors and other members of the district.  He also has good personal references and commercial contacts in the zone. His home has running water. 

Edward Miguel plants coffee, and at this point has 2 hectares of land.  He plants a coffee variety that is resistant to blight and is in his second year of production.  He has experience because previously he planted a variety of coffee called "National" and now he plants "Catimor".  He also raises cattle and has four cows in his possession.  He also grows wheat products. He will use his loan to plant and maintain 2 hectares of land.  He hopes to assure a good crop for 2015, with greater sales and thus better income to offer a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee, ensuring good production for the 2015 season.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa familiar, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Maribel se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, desde hace 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo; compra de patos, gallinas, pavos, cuyes el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor diversidad de animales esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old and lives with her life partner and two children in the family home.  They live in a rural area of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.  Her community works in agriculture, livestock and business. 

Maribel raises and sells penned animals.  She has been working in this field for two years.  Her business is located at her home.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.  The loan will help her to have a greater diversity of animals with the aim of growing her business and satisfying the needs of her customers.  This will help her increase her income over the short term and provide a better quality of life to her family over the long term.

loans.use: to purchase ducks, chickens, turkeys, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Charles's Group

texts.en:
Charles, featured in the above picture, is representing his farming group, formed by 14 farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is 68 years old and a married father of 11 children, often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Charles has been a farmer for 10 years, he is new to One Acre Fund. He decided to join this year because he really wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Even though he is new to the program, Charles wanted to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light.  Even though Charles decided not to, one farmer in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of the loan package.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona, primarily to create a better future for his children: Kamal, Safiya and Aisha.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. When asked, Musa  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like children's school fees and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Riya is the 30-year-old proud mother of six children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 12 farmers in Teso District. 

Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Riya has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.  Riya described her harvest as good last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize. She will now be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Riya’s group will be able to plant a total of 6 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a 58-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very friendly person, and is representing his group of thirteen farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Patrick has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Patrick described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Patrick’s Group will be able to plant a total of seven acres of land and purchase a total of seventeen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Murtala would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Murtala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Murtala expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, to make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for clothing and food, thereby reducing pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old, single man from Deir-El-Balah city. He lives with his parents, in a small house. His father works as an employee in a public firm, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Khaled is a student, studying Business Administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job, to improve his family's living conditions.

Khaled took a US Dollar Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily. Khaled appears in the photo, above.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies in Business Administration.

loans.name: Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
25 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Santa Elena, se formaron en la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad bastante alejada de la zona capital y que aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Las integrantes de este grupo quieren poder dar una mayor seguridad a su familia, y mejores condiciones, es por eso que están luchando.
La Sra. Liliana integrante y presidenta de este grupo, empezó con un pequeño copetín, y actualmente gracias a los anteriores ciclos, y por medio de las capacitaciones, ya es propietaria de un comedor donde prepara higiénicamente comidas y con su buen trato atrae muchos clientes. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, que con lucha y sacrificio se ha hecho camino.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su comedor, y de esa forma poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
There are 25 women who have joined the group called “Santa Elena”.  It was formed in the city of Santaní, which is located a considerable distance away from the district capital.  This area is in a period of growth.  The members of this group want to provide more security and better conditions for their families.  For this reason, they are determined.  

Sra. Liliana is a member and also the president of this group.  She started out with a small eatery.  Thanks to her previous loan cycles and the training she has received, she now owns a diner where she is able to prepare food under sanitary conditions.  Her good service also attracts many customers.  Liliana is an extremely hardworking woman who has made a path for herself through her determination and sacrifice.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for her diner.  As a result, she can continue delighting her customers with the dishes that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing the various dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Husaini

texts.en:
Husaini is a maize farmer from Kwalo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Husaini would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Husaini can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Husaini, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To meet expenses like food and clothing; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder for making tortillas.

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Webuye District and is being represented by Eliud, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 38 years old, is married and has 4 children. Eliud has been a farmer for 10 years and is often referred to as a very resourceful person.

Eliud isn't new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has change - especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Eliud will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Eliud's Group will purchase a total of 8 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 4.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy machinery and equipment

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
This is Hilda, 51, a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Hilario, a construction worker, and has three children who are all in High School. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income, in order to meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her children to school.

Hilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities, directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1000 per day.

To help her continue the operation of her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use it to buy grocery items, such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and others. She also sells and delivers chicken to her neighbors. She is positive that the loan will boost her income, as she expands her business. Her earnings help cover the family's daily expenses and send her children to school. She is thanking God and you, in advance, for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her.

Hilda hopes to maintain and grow her business, to give her children a better life. She strives to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell, such as dried fish, noodles, beverages, and toiletries

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es: Fabio comercializa queso y  pescado, hace 15 años, sus productos provienen de Magangué, lugar ubicado a orillas del rio Magdalena, donde la ganadería y la pesca son actividades  productivas principales de la región.  Fabio de 50 años habita con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 17 y 19 años, con quien tiene grandes metas pues desea lograr la posibilidad de darle estudios para potencializar su éxito futuro. Para ello trabaja de lunes a domingos desde las 6 :30 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche con el fin de lograr este sueño de prosperidad. Su meta actual es lograr ampliar su clientela por eso vivita negocio a negocio ofreciendo sus productos a crédito y de contado, para continuar incrementando su clientela de tiendas y panaderías en el sector y en los alrededores de este. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará queso, pescado en un mayor volumen, aprovechando la temporada de festividades que se acercan, en las cuales el consumo de estos productos se incrementan y genera un mayor número de clients de ingresos y de efectivo que finalizaran en el logro del bienestar para su familia
texts.en: Fabio has sold cheese and fish for 15 years.  His produce comes from Magangué, a place located on the banks of the Magdalena River where ranching and fishing are the main businesses in the region.  Fabio is 50 years old; he lives with his partner and he has two children who are 17 and 19 and for whom he has great goals, as he wants to provide them with an education to increase their potential of success in the future.  For that reason, he works from Monday to Sunday from 6:30 in the morning until 7 at night in order to achieve this dream of prosperity.  His current goal is to expand his clientele, which is why he goes from business to business offering his products for cash or credit so that he can keep increasing his clientele of stores and bakeries in the neighborhood and in its outskirts.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be the first time he finances with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and which he will use to buy cheese and fish in greater volume to take advantage of the approaching holidays when consumption of these products increases and generates a greater number of customers and income and cash that will translate to wellbeing for his family.

loans.use: to buy cheese and fish

loans.name: Hrach

texts.en:
Hrach is from Armavir. He lives there with his elderly, retired mother, wife, and two school-age children. He is involved in trade. Using his own truck, he trades in construction materials (stones and sand) in Yerevan.  As the only breadwinner in the family, Hrach works hard to gather enough income to cover basic needs.  The truck, which he uses in his work, is very old (Soviet production) and needs some improvements. 

The requested loan is very important for Hrach to make those improvements, specifically, to purchase new winter tires, repair the engine and to purchase a battery for the truck.  The loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new winter tires, engine repair and a battery for the truck.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Peter, often described as an extremely experienced farmer. He is 26 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 10 farmers in Webuye Distric, Kenya.  He is married and has 2 children.

Peter is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Peter says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has been able to consistently feed his family, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Peter will use the profits from this season to buy a cow.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 5.25 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Ayşe

texts.en:
Ayşe has done varied work. She set up a stand in the market and sold underwear and pajamas. She has two small children. She had health problems after the birth of her second child, but now she has recovered. But as a result, Ayşe had to take a break from working. 

Now she has gone into selling cosmetic products and coffee, and she has been successful. She’s about to reach the qualifications for being a manager. 

By taking on a lot of products, she’ll be able to increase her sales and earn a lot of money. With the loan from Maya, she will buy more supplies.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Ayşe hanım,çok çeşitli işler yapmış.  Pazarlarda tezgah açmış,çamaşır,pijama vs satmış.  2 çocuklu ve çocuklar küçük, 2.çocuk doğumdan beri sağlık problemleri yaşıyor.  Şimdi iyi düzeldi.  Ancak Ayşe Hanım, yaptığı işlere ara vermek zorunda kalmış.  Sonra kozmetik ürünleri ve kahve satışı işine girdi. Başarılıda oldu.  Müdürlük vasfına ulaşmak üzere.  Çok ürün çekerek satışını yükseltecek ve çok para kazanabilecek.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and coffee to sell

loans.name: Asabe

texts.en: Asabe is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Asabe joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Abigail, Yusiya, and Keziya. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Asabe would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Asabe can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Asabe  spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Erik

texts.en:
Erik is a taxi driver from Armavir. He lives there with his young wife and two little kids. 
Since 2006, Erik drives a taxi using his own car. He provides transportation both in Armavir and outside the town. He is a very kind and polite driver, so people always prefer to use his taxi. 
To be able to prepare his taxi for the winter season, Erik has applied for his loan. The loan will greatly help him to pay for a technical inspection service, to make an engine repair of the car, and to purchase new winter tires. This is very important for Erik to be able to continue his work during the winter season. 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a technical inspection service, engine repair of the car, and purchase new winter tires

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
35-year-old Ronald is man native to Dulag, Leyte.  He has a stall that displays and sells various items ranging from ladies accessories like hair clips, combs, mirrors, headbands, to other household plastic wares.  He has been engaged in this kind of business for almost 8 years.

Ronald has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy assorted stocks of  accessories ,hardware and plastic ware.
With these additional materials, he could fill his stall with variety of merchandise that could attract more customers.  He could pay his rent and other transportation expenses as well. This will help get his current business back to normal operation.

Ronald hopes to have a stable income that would help his livelihood become sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock of accessories, hardware and plastic ware

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her business by buying beer, cornmeal, and balanced feed for her animals for fattening.

loans.name: Antere

texts.en:
Anthere is 31 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 5 years, one of whom goes to school. He is a motorcyclist and has been driving for 4 years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more beans and Irish potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more beans and Irish potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yahaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child, Miracle. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yahaya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his child, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Pinar

texts.en:
Pınar has one child and has been separated from her husband for a long time. Her son is preparing to attend university.  For years she has knitted and made other handicrafts. Now, she has started making candles and wedding candies to sell. She is successful.

With this loan, she will buy supplies.  Thanks to this loan, she’ll be able to earn more money.  Pınar is striving to earn enough money for her son’s education and to have a better life.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Pınar  Hanım,1 çocuklu,eşinden yıllar önce ayrılmış.  Elişi,örgü işleri yapıyor.  Yıllardır bunu yaparken,şimdi,mum ve nikah şekeri üretip satmaya başladı. Aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Bu iş değişikliğiyle daha çok para kazanacak.  Oğlu,ünversiteye hazırlanıyor.  Oğlunun eğitimi için gerekli parayı kazanmak ve daha kaliteli yaşamak için çaba harcıyor.  Başarılı.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her craft business

loans.name: Bature

texts.en: Bature is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bature would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bature can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Bature, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es casada y tiene 4 hijos Ella y su familia viven en la comunidad de Taypillanga en unas condiciones que deben de ser mejoradas Teodora es agricultora, vende queso  y quiere un prestamo para compra de ganado vacuno con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Teodora no tiene a quien acudir pero goza de buena salud por lo que espera que puedan ayudarle
texts.en: Teodora is married and has four children.  She and her family live in the community of Taypillanga in conditions that need improvement.  Teodora is a farmer; she sells cheese and wants a loan to buy a dairy cow so she can increase her income.  Teodora does not have anyone to turn to but she enjoys good health, which is why she hopes that you can help her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 23-year-old single man from Khan Younis.  He lives with his family in a small, simple house.  His father works in the public sector where he earns a low income.  

One year ago, Thaer started a business transporting goods using a rental rickshaw.  It is a good business but the income is low because of the rental expenses. 

Thaer requested a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw instead of needing to rent one. This will help him increase his profits and improve the family living conditions. 

Thaer appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw instead of the rental one.

loans.name: Delmy Del Transito

texts.es: Delmy de 47 años de edad se dedica desde hace 9 años a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa en una zona muy transitada, por esa razon posee muchos clientes, Delmy es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo y sus dos nietos, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa de segunda mano por fardos ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Delmy is 47 years old. 

She has been selling second hand clothing for nine years. Her business is located in her home in a very busy area which is why she has many customers. Delmy is a single mother who lives in her own home with her son and two grandchildren. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more second hand clothing in bundles as this is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing in bundles

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una mujer sola que no tiene hijos y vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga, si bien su situacion no es mala, ella desea mejorar. Betty se dedica a la agricultura y afortunadamente no enfrenta ni peligros ni condiciones duras de trabajo Betty quiere un credito para la compra de ganado vacuno con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Betty goza de buena salud y tiene buena voluntad
texts.en: Betty is a single woman who does not have children and lives in the community of Taypillanga.  Though her situation is not bad, she wants to do better.  Betty works in farming and fortunately she does not face hazards or hard working conditions.  Betty wants a loan to buy a diary cow to improve her income.  Betty enjoys good health and has good intentions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Crecencia

texts.es: Crecencia es madre de un hijo y vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga donde no tiene muchas comodidades pero al menos tiene a su familia satisfecha Crecencia es agricultora, fabrica queso y quiere un credito para compra de ganado vacuno con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Crecencia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar pero goza de buena salud y necesita ayuda
texts.en: Crecencia is the mother of one child and lives in the community of Taypillanga where she does not have many conveniences, but at least her family is happy.  Crecencia is a farmer; she makes cheese and wants a loan to buy a dairy cow so she can improve her income.  Crecencia is the only source of income in her household, but she enjoys good health and needs help.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rina

texts.es: Rina de 32 años de edad se dedica a la venta de calzado jeans, suéteres, blusas, perfumería, desde hace 12 años, cuando aprendió de su tía, una mujer comerciante con quien habita. A Rina desde muy pequeña le gustó vender, comenzó haciendo sus primeros pasos con sus compañeras de escuela y de sus ingresos ayudaba a su tía en su negocio. Posteriormente se independizó  y hoy su tarea comercial no se detiene. Rina vende de contado y a crédito, cobra semanalmente sus cuentas por cobrar y trabaja diariamente desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ella conforma una familia con su conyuge y sus hijos de 4 y 13 años, con quienes sueña  tengan un futuro exitoso,. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado, suéteres, y perfumería, ella aprovechará la temporada comercial que se acerca para ganar mas, pues su propósito final es apoyar la gestión de su conyuge que se propone comprar mas adelante una casa para ofrecer mucho mas bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rina, 32 years old, has been working selling jeans, sweaters, blouses and perfumes for the last 12 years. She learned the trade from her aunt, a mercantile woman with whom Rina lives.
As a child, Rina already enjoyed selling. She took her first steps in this direction with her class mates and helped her aunt out in the business with the profits she made. Later, she got into business for herself and has been upholding this since.
Rina sells for cash and credit, she collects the outstanding accounts on a weekly basis and works daily from 10am to 9pm. She, her spouse and their children, aged 13 and 4, form a family and Rina dreams of a successful future with them.
At the moment she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financial aid she asks of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she intends to buy shoes, sweaters and perfume. She wants to use the upcoming business season to increase her profit with the intention of supporting her spouse's effort, who has set himself the goal of buying a house to increase the well-being of the family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sweaters and perfumes.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Nicolasa  de 57 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bloques de cementos, desde el año 1994, aprendiendo de su cónyuge a producir y comercializar este articulo constructivo. En su bloquera, realizan las operaciones de mezclado, moldeo y secado en las que hoy participan ambos y venden a clientes propietarios de ferretería y su vecindad en general. Cada vez mas su clientela aumenta y en especial en temporada de fin de año y tiene el desafio de tener un fondo de efectivo para comprar materias primas e insumos y producir lo requerido por su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cemento, arena al por mayor y de contado, porque su meta es incrementar su capital de trabajo y brindar a sus hijos una educación de calidad. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues aumentará su capital de trabajo, se incrementará su liquidéz y sus ventas serán mayores produciendo mas utilidades, lo cual hace exitosa la inversión de su credikiva.
J
texts.en: Nicolasa, 57 years old, has worked making and selling cement blocks since 1994, learning from her spouse how to make and sell these construction materials. In their cement block shop, they do the mixing, molding and drying and both participate in this work, and they sell to customers who are hardware store owners and in the neighborhood in general. Their customer base continues growing, especially at the end of the year, and they have the challenge of having a fund of cash to purchase raw materials and supplies and make what their customers need. This is the reason that they are turning to a Kiva loan, their first loan through Fundacíon Mario Santo Domingo,  with which they will purchase cement and sand in bulk and with cash, because the goal is to increase their working capital and offer their children a quality education. With this investment, their business will improve since they will increase their working capital, their liquidity will increase, and their sales will increase, producing more utility, which will make their Kiva loan investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand in bulk

loans.name: Jader

texts.es: Jader hace 16 años compró un camión aprovechando una buena oportunidad, inicialmente transportaba para otros particulares,  posteriormente logró ser contratado por una gran empresa para presta el servicio de trasporte de mercancías a nivel intermunicipal , pues la empresa ofrece el servicio de carga a su clientela. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar el parque automotor y apoyar la educación de sus hijos con calidad, por eso trabaja persistentemente para proveer a su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades e 20 y de 14 años, todo lo que ellos requieran para ser exitosos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará llantas y rines para uno de sus vehículos, con esta inversión transportará mas segura su mercancía y sus viajes a todos los municipios serán mas exitosos, valorizando sus activos.
texts.en: Sixteen years ago Jader bought a truck, taking advantage of a good opportunity.  Initially, he did deliveries for other individuals, then he was able contract with a large business as their transportation provider at the inter-municipal level, as this business offers delivery to its customers.  His goal for the future is to expand his automotive fleet and to support his children with a quality education.  For this reason, he works persistently to provide his household, which is made up of his partner and their two children who are 20 and 14 years old, with everything that they need to be successful.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which will be the first time he finances with Fundación Santo Domingo, to buy tires and rims for one of his vehicles.  With this investment he can transport his merchandise more securely and his trips to all the municipalities will be more successful, making the most of his assets.

loans.use: to buy tires and rims

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food materials and other items, to be able to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Hello, world. Meet Robin, a very jovial and hardworking farmer from the Nyamira region of Kenya. Nyamira is a rain-fed area popularly known for tea and banana farming. With the help of his lovely wife Jacqueline, who he married seven years ago, he is able to successfully run a rural enterprise capitalizing on his 0.5 acre piece of land. The farm consists of his home, one cow, 25 poultry, four goats and over 300 trees. 

Robin is planning to grow his farm business, but the only way he will do this without having to purchase more land is by focussing on poultry. Poultry farming is a very lucrative venture that does not require very much land space to be conducted. Robin is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more heads of poultry in a bid to boost egg production and ultimately increase his income. 

Robin's family will use the eggs produced to meet both domestic needs and commercial ends. Money generated from the sales will be used to settle the loan debt and pay part of their children's education expenses. Robin's vision is to provide for his family and meet their needs as best as he can.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Çiğdem is a university graduate who was unable to find work. She has two children and is divorced from her husband. Her children are in school. The alimony is not enough, so she had to work and earn a living. She began making perfumed soaps. As she began getting orders, her self-confidence increased. She wants to hang onto life more strongly, to develop and grow her business. With the loan from Maya, she will buy materials.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Çiğdem Hanım,ünversite mezunu iş bulamamış.  İki çocuklu ve eşinden ayrılmış.  Çocuklar okuyor.  Nafaka yetersiz.  İş yapmak ve gelir elde etmek zorunda.  Kokulu sabunlar üretmeye başladı.  Sipariş almış.  Kendine olan güveni artmış.  Hayata daha sıkı tutunmak,işini geliştirmek,büyütmek istiyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hauwa would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hauwa can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other members of her field partner, Babban Gona, Hauwa intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Saed

texts.en:
Saed is a 45-year-old married man and a father of three children living with his family in Taiz city, Yemen. He is an educated man with a university education and he works as a teacher. 

The house where Saed and his family live needs a lot more furniture. He wants to make the necessary improvements to his house but he doesn't have enough money to do so. 

For this reason, he applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase bedroom furniture for his house.

Saed hopes to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture for his house.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of 5 children. 

 Her husband's income was not enough to meet the household expenses so she started her own business of general store about 3 years ago.  Before starting her business she had not enough stock to meet the demand of her customers.  

Then she heard about Kashf Foundation, which advances loans to improve the businesses.  She contacted Kashf Foundation and got a loan of 30000 PKR.  Now she is in 4th loan cycle and wants to take another loan of 45000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including rice, sugar, salt, oil, beverages etc. for her business.  

Nasim feels proud of her own achievements.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including rice, sugar, salt, oil, beverages etc.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saratu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ephraim, Christopher and Suleiman.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, and to store her harvest so she can sell her maize later at higher prices.

loans.name: Ohene Nyame Farms Group

texts.en:
Edward is a farmer who is 57 years old. He is from Egyirkrom in the Central Region of Ghana. Edward is married and has five children, ages 20, 22, 28, 32 and 37. Four of the children are living on their own. Edward’s youngest child is in school. He has been into farming for 30 years and has 11 acres of orange farm plantation. In addition, Edward also has a vegetable farm. He sells his vegetables to the local market women to support his family. Edward plans to have another farm for foodstuffs through part of the profits from his existing farms, to diversity the cash flow patterns from his farming activities. 

His main challenge now is financing routine maintenance of his citrus farm to maximise yield and income. Edward needs a micro loan to be able to hire labour to weed the farm, to buy fertilizer, and to buy food fly traps. These items will help him maintain his citrus farm in order to increase farm output. Edward is grateful to all his micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To weed the farm, and to buy fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es viuda, tiene 3 hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa humilde de adobe que al menos es de su propiedad y no tiene defectos Maria se gana la vida como comerciante de ropa, sus productos los vende en la tienda de una de sus hijas Maria quiere un prestamo para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para vender , ella es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, sus hijos son independientes y tienen muchos gastos como para ayudarle economicamente pero la clienta goza de buena salud y espera su colaboracion
texts.en: Maria is a widow, she has 3 children and lives in La Paz in a humble adobe house which at least is her property and doesn't have any defects. Maria earns her living as a clothing vendor; she sells her products in one of her daughter's store. Maria wants a loan to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to sell. She is the only source of income in her home; her children are independent and have too many expenses to be able to help her economically, but she enjoys good health and waits for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rebeca Amparo

texts.es: Doña Rebeca de 57 años de edad posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la variedad de productos, ella vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar y está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rebeca is 57 years old and has a store located in her home.  She has many customers because of her good prices and the variety of her products.  She lives in her own home with her family group and she is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.  and thereby be able to improve her profits and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, staple grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Nestor es padre de 3 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga Nestor se gana la vida como agricultor, fabrica queso y quiere un prestamo para la compra de ganado vacuno con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Nestor no sufre de ninguna enfermedad y sus hijos tambien estan sanos Nestor no tiene a quien acudir por eso solicita ayuda de Kiva
texts.en:
Nestor is father to three children and lives in the Taypillanga community. Nestor makes a living as a farmer. He makes cheese and wants a loan to buy cattle in order to improve his income.

Nestor does not have any illnesses and his children are also healthy. Nestor does not have anyone to go to, which is why he is asking for help from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes tiene 57 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ynes is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her son and her husband. She has had a small store located in her house for a number of years. She has many customers due to her good prices and her friendliness when making sales. She is asking for a loan to be able to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc. and in this way be able to increase her income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano vende de manera ambulante por los pueblos aledaños, Ana esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa de segunda mano por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. 

She works as a street vendor selling second hand clothing in nearby towns. 

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy more wholesale second hand clothing in order to be able to continue her sales and so to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale second hand clothing

loans.name: Leonard's Group

texts.en:
Leonard, pictured above, has been a farmer for 16 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 14 farmers in Webuye District. He is 42 years old, is married and has 7 children.

Leonard likes to think of himself as a very hardworking individual. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Leonard plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Leonard’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 9.25 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 7 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
For the last  year Rodah has been selling various types of vegetables and fruits.  She earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 Kenyan.  She is married to Sammy and blessed with four children, who are all adult.

She has applied for her first loan of 30,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya.  She intends to use the loan to buy more stocks of assorted vegetables and fruits to sell.

Rodah will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and build a business premises and a home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of assorted vegetables

loans.name: Eduard

texts.en:
Eduard is 36 years old.  He is married with 5 children, aged between 4 and 12 years, all of whom go to school.  

He has a shop and has been in a retail business for 8 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more colors, cement and iron sheets to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more colors, cement and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfume, dresses, and various accessories.

loans.name: Samaila Mohammad

texts.en:
Samaila Mohammad is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila Mohammad joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Andorra, Tijjani and Usman. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila Mohammad would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila Mohammad can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Samaila Mohammad  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: Nazira is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children. She recently started a small general store at her home. Her husband is employed in a garment shop as a sales person, but does not make enough to lead his family alone. Nazira is making a great effort to support her family. She is accountable to provide for her family. However, she faced a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to fill her store. For this, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, rice, sugar, salt and cleaning products to meet the regular demand of her customers. She is positive about her future earnings and will use part of her income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, rice, sugar, salt and cleaning products

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 46-year-old married woman who operates a business buying and selling cattle. A mother of seven, she works hard to improve her family’s standard of living. 

There were some days when her husband could not find any work; consequently, Fatima and her family faced very difficult times. Then she met with a Kashf officer who informed her about micro finance and the facilities they offer. The couple then decided to take a loan so she could start her work.


Currently, Fatima has one buffalo and its babies. In order to increase her sales, she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy another buffalo. The purchase will help her meet her household expenses efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of 5 children.  Her husband is a carpenter, but his income is not enough to meet the daily expenses of his family.  So, she started her own general store with the help of Kashf foundation.

Now Safia is in her 3rd loan cycle and wants to take another loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including packs of salt, sugar, oil, rice and beverages for her business. 

Safia hopes that it will help her to boost her earnings and she will be able to provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, including packs of salt, sugar, oil, rice and beverages

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Kouser  is a 44 year old married woman and the mother of 4 children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She along with her husband (also shown in the photo) has been engaged in agriculture for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, Kouser has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en:
Yohanna is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohanna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohanna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Yohanna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yusha'u

texts.en: Yusha'u is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusha'u joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bashir, Isamail, and Abubakar. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusha'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to receive cash for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusha'u can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusha'u  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer from Badamasi village in Kaduna state.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs.  

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  

Sani, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices immediately at harvest

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sule joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Alisa, Ladi and Ezikel.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for a low price soon after harvest to address his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sule  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for child's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Vailet

texts.en:
Vailet is 29 years old, living in mundri and has no children.  Her mother has two boys and one girl, none of whom are in school.  

She is try to run a small business selling beans, cups,and Powershiba.  Vailet has been as a client of WOYE MFI for one year.  

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family now.

loans.use: To buy a more goods for her business

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel es soltero y tiene un hijo, el cliente vive en La Paz con su familia en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Abel es comerciante de miel Abel quiere un credito para la compra de miel en bruto o en gran cantidad, puesto que el cliente la coloca en frascos para su posterior venta Abel es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar, pero tanto él como su familia gozan de buena salud Abel espera poder acceder al credito
texts.en: Abel is single and has a child. He lives in La Paz with his family in a brick and cement house which is his property. Abel is a honey vendor. Abel wants a loan to purchase raw honey, or in great quantities, since he bottles it for sale. Abel is the only source of income in his home, but he and his family have good health. Abel hopes to be able to get a loan.

loans.use: to purchase honey.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 12 farmers in Webuye District. She is 43 years old, is married and has 5 children.

Jane likes to think of herself as a very resourceful person. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wants to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Jane plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Jane’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Lydiah's Group

texts.en:
Lydiah is a 30-year-old proud mother of 5 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing her group of 7 farmers in Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Lydiah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Lydiah described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Lydiah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 4.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Asuman

texts.en:
Asuman has two children and is a seamstress. In a room of her house, she was sewing sheets for hotels, but making very little money. She is trying to set up a workshop in the garden of her house, where she will work. She has gotten some new work: she is decorating baby cradles and cribs. Her income has increased. She’ll be able to work more comfortably outside of her house. With the loan from Maya, she will buy supplies.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Asuman Hanım,2 çocuklu,dikiş dikiyor.  Evinin odasında otellere çarşaf dikiyordu.  Çok az bir gelir elde ediyor.  Evinin bahçesine,bir atölye kurmaya çalışıyor.  Atölyede çalışacak,yeni iş almış.  Bebek beşikleri,bebek sepetleri süslüyor.  Hem geliri arttı,hem de evinin dışında daha rahat çalışacak. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Valary's Group

texts.en:
Valary's group is formed by 15 farmers in Butere District.  It is being represented by Valary, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 30 years old, is married, and has 4 children. Valary has been a farmer for five years and is often referred to as a very trustworthy person.

Valary isn’t new to One Acre Fund.  She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed her life has changed; especially in that she has learned a lot from farming trainings ever since. 

This year, Valary will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but  she will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition.  Now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Valary's group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 9 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabecca is 35 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and represents a group formed by 16 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Rabecca has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Rabecca also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about.  It will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Rabecca's Group will be able to receive a total of 14 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anaruwa

texts.en: Anaruwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Anaruwa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child: Gidiyon.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Anaruwa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to address his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Anaruwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Anaruwa  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his son, eventually hoping to ensure he is educated and has access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed  is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of 4 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Naheed wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently and thereby boost her earnings to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently and thereby boost her earnings

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is 35 years old and married. She has five children. 

She has been running a business of buying and selling cattle, along with her husband  for many years. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for their feeding, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business provides them with income to support their family. 

However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, health, and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Naziran has requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to buy more livestock, such as baby goats and calves, for resale. 

She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving their living standard, and she can also use her income on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more livestock, such as baby goats and calves, for resale

loans.name: Afsheen

texts.en:
Afsheen is 24-year-old married woman. 

She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Afsheen’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. 

Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Afsheen  has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, so she can provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Summer

texts.en:
Summer  is 47 years old, and is married with 2 children.  

Summer is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living.  She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand.  Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR.  This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time and earn good profits.  This loan can take Summer closer to her dream of providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time and to earn good profits.

loans.name: Abarroteros Group

texts.es:
Don Tomás forma parte del grupo “Abarroteros” es un hombre muy trabajador, siempre está al pendiente de las necesidades de su familia y en la mejor disposición para apoyar a quien lo necesite. Tiene 56 años de edad y está casado desde hace 38 con la señora Petra; juntos formaron una familia con cinco hijos que actualmente ya son independientes.

Tomás inició trabajando como chofer de un taxi durante ocho años, sus ahorros fueron constantes porque su sueño era comprarse un automóvil para tener su propio taxi y dejar de trabajar para alguien más. Lo complicado del proceso, fue conseguir los permisos para transitar libremente como taxista por las comunidades, pero con la ayuda de su hermano, quien también forma parte del grupo, consiguió el permiso necesario. Hace ocho años que conoce a VisionFund, y está muy agradecido por la confianza y los préstamos que se le han otorgado ya que sin ellos no habría sido posible comprar el vehículo. 

Ya son 17 años de experiencia tras el volante y trabajando de lunes a viernes desde las 5 am. Sin embargo, hace algunos días Tomás enfermó lo cual le impidió seguir manejando y tuvo que contratar a un empleado. Tomás no sabe cuánto durará este periodo, pero espera con ansias volver a las calles a trabajar. “Llevo toda mi vida en el taxi por eso mismo no puedo estar aquí en casa” comentó Don Tomas. Su empleado debe esmerarse para obtener buenas ganancias, cada semana entrega aproximadamente 100 USD de ganancias.

Actualmente, Don Tomás necesita invertir para comprar llantas nuevas y en caso de que sobre dinero, hará cambio de aceite. Su sueño es continuar con su taxi pero también quisiera abrir una tienda de abarrotes para tener otro ingreso que le ayude a solventar los gastos de su hogar con mayor facilidad. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo “Abarroteros” también necesitan invertir en sus negocios: J. Cruz en refacciones para su taxi y Ambrosio en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Al igual que Don Tomás, ellos están muy agradecidos con sus créditos porque sus negocios han crecido y la calidad de vida de sus familias han mejorado. 

La foto fue tomada en una fuente, que es el corazón del jardín del municipio, Don Tomas es el más bajo de estatura.
texts.en:
Tomás is part of the "Abarroteros" group. He is a very hard-working man, always at hand for his family's needs, and has the best disposition to help whoever needs it. He is 56 years old, has been married for 38 years to Petra, and together they made a family with five children who are now all independent. 

Tomás began working as a taxi driver for eight years. His savings were consistent because his dream was to buy himself a car to have his own taxi and to stop working for someone else. The complicated part of the process was to get the permits to travel freely as a taxi driver throughout the communities but, with the help of his brother, who is also part of the group, he got the necessary permits. Eight years ago, he learned about VisionFund and is very grateful for the confidence and the loans that they have offered him since without them, it would not have been possible to purchase a vehicle. 

He now has 17 years of experience behind the wheel and is working Monday to Friday starting at 5 AM. However, a few days ago, Tomás got sick, which prevented him from continuing to drive and he had to hire an employee. Tomás doesn't know how long this period will last, but he is anxious to get back to the streets to work. "I have spent my whole life in the taxi and this reason I can't be here at home," Tomás said. His employee has to go to a lot of effort to have good earnings, each week turning in approximately 100 US dollars of earnings. 

Currently, Tomás needs to invest in the purchase of new tires and, if he has extra money, he will change the oil. His dream is to continue with his taxi but he would also like to open a grocery store to have additional income that will help him to pay for the household expenses more easily. 

The other members of the "Abarroteros" group also need to invest in their businesses: J. Cruz in repairs for his taxi, and Ambrosio in his small grocery store. Along with Tomás, they are very grateful for their loans because their businesses have grown and their families' quality of life has improved. 

The photo was taken at a fountain, which is at the heart of the municipal garden. Tomás is the one of shortest stature.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Mirna Concepcion

texts.es: Mirna de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol, con la ventas que realiza logra salir adelante, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventanas en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de puertas, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra y asi pueda ella y su familia vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Mirna is 48 years old, lives in her own house with her two children and her husband, and works growing corn and beans. With the sales that she makes, she manages to get ahead. She wants to improve her home, installing doors and windows in the place shown in the photo, but with what she earns, she doesn't have enough to be able to do it. For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase doors, bars and glass for the windows, and to pay labor costs, and in this way her family and she will be able to live more securely.

loans.use: to purchase doors, bars and glass for the windows, and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda es madre de 4 hijos y vive en la comunidad de Taypillanga en unas condiciones que ella desea mejorar Arminda es agricultora, fabrica queso y cria ganado, desea un credito para la compra de ganado vacuno para poder mejorar sus ingresos Arminda no tiene a quien acudir pero goza de buena salud por lo que se recomienda otorgar el credito
texts.en:
Arminda is the mother of four children and lives in the community of Taypillanga and wants to improve her living conditions. Arminda works in farming, manufacturing cheese and breeding cattle. She wants a loan in order to buy cattle to improve her income. Arminda has no one else to turn to. 

“She is in good health and we recommend granting her a loan!”

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Suhaib

texts.en:
Suhaib is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Irbid with his family.  Suhaib is studying his bachelors degree in accounting and is in his third year. His dad is a retired military officer and his brother works in the military, too. 

Suhaib has a part time job that helps him in paying for the university fees, but he now has some shortages in covering his next semester's fees and it is for that Suhaib is applying for this educational loan. 

Suhaib’s future plan is to finish his higher degree, and find a job related to his field of study.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Samra

texts.en: Samra  is 40 years old, married, and a mother of 5 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She is very knowledgeable of sewing techniques. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy sewing materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as spools of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is 32 years old and married. She works in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her embroidery. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams of a bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones to embellish her embroidery

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en: Irimiya is a maize farmer from Nakala village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to address his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Irimiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Irimiya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Naziran is 49 years old. She is a married woman who is a mother of 9 children. She is working hard to fulfill their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education.  

Along with her husband, she has been doing work in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.
