She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Naziran has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 54 years old and has 4 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by ten farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs for planting a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es: Rogelia es divorciada, tiene una hija y vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino donde paga un anticretico Rogelia se gana la vida comercializando artesanias en ferias locales Rogelia quiere un credito para incrementar el numero de artesanias que vende, ella  recibe asistencia familiar del esposo pero eso no es suficiente Al menos Rogelia y su hija gozan de buena salud y la clienta espera poder acceder al credito
texts.en: Rogelia is divorced, she has a daughter and lives in La Paz in a well-finished house where she pays an "anticrético" [she pays rent until she has paid off the house cost]. Rogelia earns her living selling crafts in local festivals. Rogelia wants a loan to increase the number of crafts that she sells. She gets family support from her husband, but this is not sufficient. At least Rogelia and her daughter have good health and she hopes to be able to get the loan.

loans.use: to increase the number of crafts that she sells.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa tiene dos hijos y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Taypillanga en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad Narcisa es agricultora, fabrica queso y afortunadamente no tiene condiciones duras de trabajo ni peligros Narcisa quiere un credito para la compra de ganado vacuno con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos Narcisa no tiene a quien acudir pero goza de buena salud y espera acceder a un credito de Kiva
texts.en: Narcisa has two children and lives with her family in the community of Taypillanga in an adobe house that is her property. Narcisa is a farmer. She makes cheese and luckily doesn't have hard or dangerous working conditions. Narcisa wants a loan to purchase cattle with the end of increasing her income. Narcisa doesn't have anyone to turn to but she has good health and hopes to get a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 27 years old, and married to Lilian.  They do not have children yet. He has been in transportation business for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000 (Kenyan Shillings).
	 		
He has applied for his second loan of 30,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy spare parts and to repair his vehicle, so that he can give good service to his customers.                                                                                          
William will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Herminda Graciela

texts.es: Herminda es una señora muy trabajadora, ella vive con su esposo y con sus 3 hijos mismos que se encuentran estudiando, Herminda trabaja junto a sus esposo en un a hacienda donde cuidan ganado, el crédito lo va invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que el patrón de la hacienda de donde trabaja le hace tener una vaca y no le cobra de la hierba, ella aspira mejorar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y de ser posible ahorrar capital para a futuro comprar una casa y que no le haga falta para la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Herminda is a very hard-working woman. She lives with her husband and their three children, who go to school. Herminda works alongside her husband on a farm where they raise cattle. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow since the owner of the farm where she works is letting her have the cow and will not charge for the grass. She hopes to improve her business and increase her income and if possible save capital so in the future she can purchase a house and not let it go for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine works at city hospital as a lab tech. A nurse by profession, Lusine, also provides overtime visits to people who need medical service at home. Lusine is a very caring and devoted nurse, who loves her work.
Now, to be able to purchase microscope, which she needs for her work, Lusine has applied for this loan. 
Lusine relies on lenders' support as this purchase is very important for her work as a nurse. Her loan loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new microscope needed to provide medical service

loans.name: Alfred's Group

texts.en:
Alfred is 45 years old and has 6 children. He has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very reliable person. Even though Alfred is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Alfred started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wants to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Alfred’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.en:
Muqadas, a 22-year-old vigorous married mother of two children, knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls and has had a hand-embroidery business for many years.  She is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly everyday. Her husband does not earn enough alone to support his family well. 

Because Muqadas’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, needles, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand. In order to gain more profits, she hopes to eventually open her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, needles, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Daniel Ibrahim

texts.en: Daniel Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to address his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Daniel Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yohana would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to addess his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yohana can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yohana is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing  for his family and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La Sra. Nora tiene 36 años, esta casada, su marido es empleado y ella trabaja en una cafetería y es vendedora de lencerías, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar, por quienes ella y su esposo están esforzándose para darle una vida digna.
La señora  anteriormente vendía ropas de forma ambulante, hasta que un día se decidió y empezó a vender ropa interior femenina traída del Brasil. Actualmente cuenta con una importante cantidad de clientes, y quiere poder cumplir con los pedidos de ellos. En el futuro le gustaría  montar una taller de confecciones y dedicarse exclusivamente a realizar ropas interiores.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de lencería femenina, y así seguir con su trabajo y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Nora is 36 years old and married. Her husband is an employee, while she works at a cafeteria. Nora also sells lingerie. She has two daughters who are of school age. For this reason, she and her husband strive to provide them a decent life.

Sra. Nora previously sold clothing as a street vendor. One day, she decided to begin selling women’s undergarments that were shipped in from Brazil. She now has a considerable number of customers, so she wants to be able to fulfill their orders. In the future, Nora would like to open a sewing workshop where she can produce undergarments exclusively.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of women’s lingerie. As a result, she can continue her work and her sales.

loans.use: to buy women's lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Ata

texts.en:
Ata is a 29-year-old married man from Khan Younis.  He lives with his wife and four children in a small, simple house.  

He works in the public sector where he earns a low income.  One year ago, Ata decided to work another job to improve the family's living conditions, so he started transporting goods using an old rickshaw.  It is a good business and has provided the family with a good income.

Ata requested a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.  This will help him to increase his productivity and income and improve the family's living conditions.

Ata appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace his old one.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia  Nancy se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar,la socia vende regalos y peluches,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
La socia Nancy se sigue dedicando al negocio de bazar,la socia vende regalos y peluches,la socia por medio de estos negocios quiere salir adelante.La socia solicita el credito para comprar adornos y peluches.



La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.

loans.use: to buy decorations and plush toys.

loans.name: Andrea Auxiluadora

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Unión Y Fortaleza se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio La Dolorosa en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Andrea, tiene 36 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 5 años,  el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña Andrea es una muy buena esposa que para ayudarle a su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene un taller de ebanistería donde elabora puertas, camas y muebles de toda clase y modelos, trabaja a base de pedidos de clientes particulares, a su esposo no le falta el trabajo por el buen trabajo que realiza y por la responsabilidad ya que entrega los trabajos en el día indicado, el lleva más de 20 años con su taller y gracias a Dios casi nunca le falta trabajo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar madera y otros materiales para elaborar los muebles. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sentirse útil y ayudar a su marido a salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Unión y Fortaleza loan group meets every two weeks in the La Dolorosa neighborhood of Manta, a city known for its lovely beaches which are visited by many all year long and for being a city with unequaled beauty with many tourist attractions.

In this place lives Andrea. She is 36 years old, married, and in this relationship has two children, ages 16 and 5. The older one is a secondary school student and the younger one is in primary school. Her husband is a cabinetmaker.

Andrea is a very good wife who, in order to help her husband, takes out a loan so that he can use it in his work. He has a cabinetry shop where he makes doors, beds, and all sorts and models of furniture. He works based on his customers' orders. Her husband doesn't lack for work because of the good work that he does and for his responsibility since he produces the work on the day indicated. He has worked for more than 20 years in his workshop and, thanks to God, he has never lacked work. 

This loan will be used to purchase wood and other materials to make furniture. She has been in the loan group for 5 years and she likes it because, with the loans, she can feel useful and help her husband get ahead. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase wood and other materials to make furniture.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 66 years old and has 11 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 16 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

John has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to the best seed prices and, although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. John also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that John's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry, barbed wire and a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 46 years old and is a hard working woman.  She has been successfully running a small general store to provide for her family expenses. She has become popular in her street and counts a good client list. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently and to boost her earnings. 

She dreams for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently and to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Saeedan

texts.en:
Saeedan , 51 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store with the support of her son.  She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base.  In order to avoid shortages, Saeedan  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 55000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and improve earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and improve earnings.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 33 years old, married, and a mother of three children. She has been doing the business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the household expenses with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, cloth and laces, to meet the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Nagina hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, cloth and laces.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is a 29 year-old-married man from Khan younis. He lives with his wife in a small simple house. He works in the public sector where he gets a low income. He decided to work at another job to improve the family living conditions, so he started working in transferring goods using an old rickshaw. It is a good business and provide the family with a good income.
Ameen requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one. This will help him to increase his productivity and income and improve the family living conditions.
Ameen appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to replace the old one.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en: Anees is 46 years old and married. She runs a business selling milk and has done so for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 6 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn more income to provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a better income to provide a better living for her children.

loans.name: Dimas Eladio

texts.es: Don Dimas de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de toretes para engordarlos y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Dimas is 59 years old and lives in his own home along with his wife. He has been raising and fattening cattle for 20 years. Dimas sells his products at different markets near his house.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy young bulls for fattening. As a result, he can continue his work so that he can generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy young bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia Carmen Rosa se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa has a grocery business where she sell basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Carmen has been in this business for five years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

Carmen is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Nicodemus

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders, meet Nicodemus - 23 years of age, honest, humble and a very hardworking person!   He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile and has one of the best weather patterns on earth for farming.  Nicodemus is still single and has so much that he wants to achieve before starting a family.  That is why he is focused and dreaming of being successful.  Nicodemus never got the chance to go to college because of lack of fees, but this never killed the zeal that he had for succeeding, and he started farming five years ago on a small plot of farmland that he inherited from his parents. 

Through hard work he has managed to practice crop farming and animal farming, and has been able to take care of his parents and also take care of his basic needs.  Nicodemus grows vegetables, fruits and keeps dairy cows as a source of income.  Although Nicodemus has been making profits, he is challenged by timely delivery of products to the market.  This has made his profits go down, because goods reach the market when they are not fresh and hence fetch lower prices.  

Nicodemus comes from an area that has poor feeder roads and this has been a major problem to him. That is why he is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to buy a motorbike.  With the motorbike, Nicodemus will be able to transport his farm produce to the market and deliver it in a timely manner, and hence it will fetch higher prices.  Vegetables, fruits and milk are perishable products and they require quick delivery to the market, so this motorbike will be of so much help. 

Through timely delivery of his product, Nicodemus is sure of increased profits and this will translate to better living conditions and a secure future.   Nicodemus is very ambitious and he is planning that once he has accumulated more profits, he will be able to go back to school.  Through education he will be able to have a more secure future, because education is “the key to success.”

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get his products to market while they are still fresh

loans.name: Fatsima

texts.en: Fatsima is a maize farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Fatsima would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to address her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Fatsima can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Fatsima, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale in the market.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is 38 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales.  She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn greater profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn greater profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Orfa Lucrecia

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como  Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor un lugar agradable en el que se puede pasar buenos momentos en Familia. 
En esta Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Orfa una mujer luchadora de 55 años, es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos el mayor de 33 años y el ultimo de 13 años solo él depende y vive con ella, tienen una pequeña tienda de víveres en general, aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia cuando se separo tuvo que enfrentarse a la vida sola con sus hijos pequeños, y gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación pudo salir adelante y ayudar a que sus hijos se preparen y no tengan los mismos problemas que ella, viene de familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos y no pudo prepararse solo tiene primaria 
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio en el arreglo y ampliación de la tienda, con esta nueva inversión mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y podrá continuar ayudando a el último de sus hijos, la señora Orfa agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is known as the canton of love full of friendly, hardworking people. It is a touristy place, with diverse waterfalls, inns, and a marvelous climate. Here we find in the waterfall of love an agreeable place to spend good times with the family.

Orfa lives and has her business in this canton. She is a 55 year old fighting woman. She is a single mother with 4 children. The oldest is 33 years old and the last born is 13 years old, dependent, and he lives with her. 

They have a small general grocery store. She learned this activity through her own initiative when she separated and had to face life alone with her young children. Thanks to her great effort and dedication she could get ahead and support her children, preparing them so they would not have the same problems as her. She comes from a humble family with low income and only attended primary school.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in the business, fixing up and expanding the store. This new investment will improve her income so she can continue supporting the last of her children. Orfa is grateful to Fundación Alternative and Kiva for the support and opportunity provided.

loans.use: to invest in and expand her business, increasing her income so she can offer better opportunities in life to her younger son

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children.  She has been in the business of cattle sales with her husband for many years. She works hard to provide basic necessities to her family.  There were some days when her husband could not find any work and they faced many difficult situations.  

After meeting Kashf’s loan officer, Naseem and her husband became aware of micro-finance options.  They decided to take a loan so they could start their work.  Currently, they have one buffalo.  Naseem requested a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase baby buffalo and goats in order to expand her business. 

She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby buffalo and goats in order to expand her business

loans.name: Qishmish

texts.en:
Qishmish is hard working woman from Maralik town.  Qihmish's elder son is married and he and his wife and little child live with her.  Her second son moved to Russia to find a job. 

To sustain her family's living, Qishmish, works in clothing sales.  From her house, she sells different clothing which she gets from Gyumri. 

Qishmish is an enthusiastic and hard working woman who works hard to meet her customers' demands.  To be able to purchase new stock of winter clothing and cover current demands, Qishmish has applied for this loan.  It has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International.  

This program provides business start-up loans with lower requirements to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for winter

loans.name: Enso Nyame Ye Farm Group

texts.en: Mary, a 46 year-old-woman has 6 people depending on her  of whom 3 of them are her own children with the ages of 12, 27 and 29.  Two of the children are still in school. Mary is a divorced woman who takes care of all her dependents single handedly. Mary is from Egyirkrom in the Abura Asebu Kwamankese District in the Central Region of Ghana. She is the representative of Enso Nyame Ye Farm Group. Mary has 20 years farming experience and has a 4 acre lime plantation. She also cultivates cassava and maize and sells them herself to the local market women. Mary has an ambition to enlarge her lime farm in the future so that she can earn more income to be able to see her dependents through. Mary needs micro loan support to be able to prune and weed her lime plantation to increase output. A portion of the group loan will help Mary to maintain her lime farm to increase yield and income.  Mary is thankful to all her micro lenders for their generosity in helping her meet her goals.

loans.use: To weed the farm, buy a fertilizer and food fly traps

loans.name: Rotik

texts.en:
For the last 10 years Rotik has been in livestock trading, where he buys and sells livestock and earns a monthly income of KES 90,000 (Kenyan Shillings). He is married to Judith and blessed with three children who go to school.

He has applied for his first loan of 100,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more cows and sheep for rearing and selling later for a profit.  Rotik will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep for rearing and selling later for a profit.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 34-year-old woman married to Charles who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with three children.  Rachel is a farmer who has been operating in the agricultural business for six years earning herself an income of 6,000 KES at the end of every month.

Rachel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of 10,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings to boost her farming production. 

Rachel plans to use the anticipated income to start a poultry business and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Johayhu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Johayhu está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
Pabla es una de ellas, una vendedora humilde de prendas, comenta que su trabajo es sacrificado, pero que lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia, y lo hace tan bien que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Pide este préstamo para poder surtirse con prendas varias, y así seguir con su trabajo.
Todas ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para crecer.
texts.en:
The group named “Johayhu” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. The members are from the city of Concepción, which is in an area that is quite distant from the central district and is experiencing a period of growth. Even though this area is difficult to access, the members of this group are determined to grow and make their community a better place to live so that it can experience steady development.

Pabla is one of the group members. She is a humble clothing vendor who says that her work requires sacrifice. However, she is willing to work in order to help her family. Pabla is doing well because she has a well-established clientele. She is requesting a loan in order to restock with various types of clothes. This will allow her to continue her work.

All of the members are putting forth their best effort so that they can grow.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a married mother of five children, four of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

For over two and half years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 31 and single and has no children. He lives with his mother and his youngest brother in the rural area district, which has tea, coffee and bananas. 

Edward raises and sells farm animals such as goats, chickens and pigs. He is experienced, so he has many customers. Edward also works as a farmhand and has a big pen for his agricultural activities. He has good personal references.

Edward will use the loan to buy animals and expand the pen where he raises them. By investing in his business, he will make better profits and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goats and pigs.

loans.name: Jackson's Group

texts.en:
Jackson is 64 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 16 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Jackson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although he described his last harvest as poor, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jackson also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jackson's Group will be able to receive a total of 13 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Saratu Anthoni

texts.en:
Saratu Anthoni is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  Saratu Anthoni joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child, Bitrus.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu Anthoni would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.  With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu Anthoni can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.  

When asked, Saratu Anthoni spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her child, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn immediately at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: David's Group

texts.en:
David is a 45-year-old proud father of 6 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and he is representing his group of 12 farmers in the Butere District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, David has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

David described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. In addition to purchasing fertilizer and maize with the loan, he is very excited to purchase a solar light because with it, he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, David’s Group will be able to plant a total of 7.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a hard working young man from Goris town.  He works in construction.  Artur, more specifically, provides internal and external constructional design of houses and does renovations.  Just because he enjoys doing what he does, his clients always prefer to hire Artur. 

This young man is married, with wife and 6-years-old son, and is the only worker in their family. 

To be able to purchase new tools (cutting and piercing) needed for his construction work, Artur has applied for this loan.  The loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. 

This program provides business start-up loans with lower requirements to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cutting and piercing tools needed for construction work

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elizabeth se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas , la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende platanos, naranjas y manzanas , la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas, plátanos y manzanas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth continues to manage her business of selling fruit. She conducts her business in different places. She sells bananas, oranges, and apples. Maria Elizabeth wants to move forward and do well in her business. She dreams of having a shop where she can sell fruit. Maria Elizabeth is requesting a loan in order to buy oranges, bananas, and apples.

She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, and apples.

loans.name: Rhulangane Group

texts.fr: Hamuli est commerçante et présidente de la banque communautaire Rhulangane, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un agent de la fonction publique, âgée de 53 ans, mère de 10 enfants, dont 8 scolarisés et 2 sont mariés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds de reçu d’un membre de la famille. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 30 ans. Elle va acheter 10 ballons de souliers. Elle souhaite obtenir plus des crédits, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Hamuli is a shopkeeper and the president of the Rhulangane borrowing group, which is a client of IMF Hekima. She is married to a civil servant. She is 53 years old and the mother of 10 children, eight of whom went to school and two of whom are married.

She started her business with funds received from a family member. She has been selling used shoes in a village market for 30 years. She will buy 10 bales of shoes. 

She would like to receive more loans, and educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy 10 bales of shoes.

loans.name: Shangwe Group

texts.fr: Muhindo est commerçante, présidente de la banque communautaire Shangwe, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un Technicien, âgée de 43 ans, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle est vendeuse de divers habillements dans un magasin de la ville depuis 8 ans. Elle va acheter des vestes, pagnes, pantalons, chemises, souliers, jupes, sous vêtements, Singlin. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Muhindo is a retailer and the president of the Shangwe community bank.  She is also a client of Hekima and married to a technician.  Muhindo is 43 years old and she has four children who all go to school.  She started her own business with a capital received from her husband.  For the past eight years, she has been selling various clothing items in a shop, in town.

Muhindo is going to buy jackets, "pagnes" (colorful African fabrics), pants, shirts, shoes, skirts and "Singlin" underwear.  She would like to make more profits and be able to feed her children and cover their school fees.  She thanks Hekima for the support they provide to entrepreneurs with no access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy jackets, "pagnes", pants, shirts, shoes, skirts and "Singlin" underwear.

loans.name: Şenay

texts.en:
Senay has married children so she is alone at home with her husband whose retirement they both depend on. She would like to do additional work so as not to be a burden on their grown children. With an old machine, she has started taking on sewing jobs but the machine is not good enough to produce quick results. With the credit from Maya, she would like to buy an industrial strength sewing machine so that she can produce work quicker and earn income faster.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Şenay hanım,çocuklarını evlendirmiş.  Evde eşi ile tek başına kalmış.  Eşinin emekli maaşıyla geçiniyorlar.  Çocuklarına da yük olmak istemiyor.  Ek iş yapmak istemiş.  Evinde olan eski  makine ile dikişe başlamış.  Ancak,iş üretemiyor.  Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile sanayi tipi dikiş makinesi alarak işini daha iyi ve çabuk yapacak.  Daha fazla para kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy an industrial strength sewing machine.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a 40-year-old, hardworking woman married to Thomas, who adds additional income to support their family.  They are blessed with one child.  Priscillah has been operating a clothing business shop for a period of three years, earning herself an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Priscillah was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts, and bed sheets to add to her current stock, which is running out.

Priscillah plans to use the anticipated income to start a shoe selling business as a secondary business, and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, skirts and bedsheets to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Luriana

texts.en:
Holiday season is coming soon and Luriana wants to sell ornaments.  She needs your help for this.

This time she's been photographed with Ramadan, her husband, and her little one who excitedly requested to be in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy toys and holiday ornaments to sell.

loans.name: Talatu Saratu

texts.en:
Talatu Saratu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. She joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Bulus, Nicodimus and Hufre.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Talatu Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Talatu Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Talatu Saratu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure that they are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El socio Nelson se dedica al negocio de transporte de carga, el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio a la ciudad de lima llevando carga, el socio trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelson continues to manage his cargo transport business. He has a car that he uses for providing cargo services throughout the city of Lima. Nelson has been working at this business for seven years and is doing very well. He dreams of purchasing a new car. Nelson is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for his car.

He is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La socia Rina se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rina works selling clothes and shoes. She sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. She has been in this business for several years and does very well. Her dream is to have a shop. She is requesting the loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses. 

She is very happy because of the loan and promises to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Victor Fernando

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 25 años, soltero, que vive en casa de familiares durante 2 años en el Barrio de Guapulo en la ciudad de Latacunga, gracias al esfuerzo que han hecho sus padres el pudo culminar sus estudios secundarios, por herencia de su padre el pudo aprender el oficio de la producción de bloque lo que durante 3 años ha sido su sustento de vida. Víctor solicita su crédito para la compra de más materiales que requiere en su trabajo. 
Víctor agradece a FUNDACION ALTERNATIVA y a KIVA por hacer posible cumplir sus sueños de construir su propia casa e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Víctor is a man of 25, single, who has lived in a family house for 2 years in the neighborhood of Guapulo in the city of Latacunga. Thanks to the effort that his parents put forth, he was able to finish secondary school. Through his father, he was able to learn the trade of cinderblock production which, for 3 years, has been his life sustenance. Víctor is applying for his loan for the purchase of more materials that he needs for his work. Victor is thankful for Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for making it possible to achieve his dreams of building his own house and increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy materials that he needs to increase his income in the future to build his own house.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
Aramayis runs a garage where he provides vehicle repair services for locals in Goris town. He lives there with his wife (a teacher at a local school) and 4-year-old daughter. 

Aramayis's garage is not very big, but the good quality service that he provides helps him to receive a number of orders during the month. Aramayis realizes that his garage is very old and now requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. So, he has applied for this loan to ask for financial support and be able to pay for renovation of the garage, and purchase new spare parts and tools for providing vehicle repair services.
 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is very important help for Aramayis and he really hopes for your goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his garage and purchase new spare parts and tools for providing vehicle repair services.

loans.name: El Castillo 2 Group

texts.es:
Rodeada por cerros y cañales se encuentra la comunidad donde se conformó un grupo llamado “El Castillo 2”. Los integrantes tienen una actividad económica de la cual obtienen ganancias para solventar los gastos de su familia:

Alicia- Venta De Plantas Y Abono
Minerva- Se Dedica A La Venta De Pollo
Margarita-Venta De Cosméticos
Evarista-Venta De Pollo
Jessica-Venta De Refrescos
Eduardo- Venta De Maíz, Fertilizantes Y Abono
Lidia-Venta De Postres 
Mariela-Venta De Calzado
Lizeth- Venta De Ropa 
Rebeca-Venta De Pan

Doña Evarista está casada con el señor Domingo, son padres de dos jóvenes quienes trabajan en la capital del país.  Ella se ha dedicado a vender carne de pollo desde hace ya 12 años aunque por temporadas también vende pollo asado, dulces, accesorios para el cabello e incluso prepara pasta de mole para que las personas puedan preparar el tradicional platillo mexicano. Siempre dispuesta a ofrecer el mejor servicio a sus clientes, Evarista se levanta todos los días a las 5 de la mañana para comenzar a limpiar el pollo y así a las 6:30 está lista para recibir a su primer cliente. Por lo general, la carne de los pollos que limpia en la mañana se termina en cuestión de horas, pero si por la tarde, una persona llega a su casa para comprar, sin problemas ella limpia el animal y prepara la carne para entregarla. Evarista vende de 7 a 10 pollos diario.

Lo que más le gusta a Evarista de su comunidad es la fiesta del 12 de diciembre, día en que se celebra a la Virgen de Guadalupe y puede aprovechar para vender aun más pollo. Las personas aprovechan la fecha religiosa para organizar bautismos, matrimonios colectivos, primeras comuniones, confirmaciones y con ello fiestas donde invitan a toda su familia. En muchos casos el pollo es parte elemental de la comida. En este día, Evarista ha vendido hasta 72 pollos.

Los préstamos otorgados por VisionFund le han sido de gran ayuda ya que tiene la posibilidad de invertir en su negocio, por ejemplo, actualmente necesita comprar 24 pollos y bolsas de plástico que utiliza para entregar su producto. En su comunidad, la temporada de zafra (corte de caña) se acerca y la economía del lugar prospera, sabe que tiene que estar preparada con suficiente carne para satisfacer a sus clientes. "Espero poder vender pollos asados a la leña, acompañados con arroz y salsa cada fin de semana mientras dure la zafra", de esta manera las ganancias e inversión incrementarán y dará mayor estabilidad a su negocio.

Lo que jamás olvidará Evarista son las palabras de una de sus hijas “Gracias por todo lo que me has dado" y ella sabe que no ha sido fácil, pero su esfuerzo y las inversiones le han ayudado a mantener su negocio.

*La fotografía fue tomada en uno de los nacimientos de agua de la comunidad, lugar que eligieron las clientas, doña Evarista viste de blusa amarilla.
texts.en:
Surrounded by hills and rivers lies the community where the "El Castillo 2" group was formed. Its members have different economic activities from which they generate income to cover their home expenses:

Alicia -- Sale of plants and fertilizer
Minerva -- Sale of chickens
Margarita -- Sale of cosmetics
Evarista -- Sale of chickens
Jessica -- Sale of soft drinks
Eduardo -- Sale of corn and fertilizers
Lidia -- Sale of desserts
Mariela -- Sale of shoes
Lizeth -- Sale of clothes
Rebeca -- Sale of bread

Evarista is married to Domingo. They have a son and a daughter who work in the capital. She has been selling chicken meat for 12 years, even though at times she also sells roasted chicken, hair accessories and even makes mole paste so that people can prepare the traditional Mexican dish. She is always ready to provide the best possible service to her clients. Evarista wakes up at 5:00 a.m. every day to begin cleaning the chickens -- that way she is ready to receive her first customers at 6:30 a.m. Generally, the chicken meat that she cleans in the morning sells out in a matter of hours. However, if somebody arrives at her house to buy meat, she has no problem cleaning the animal and preparing the meat. Evarista sells from 7 to 10 chickens per day. 

What Evarista most likes about her community is the December 12 Virgin of Guadalupe celebration. That day, she can sell even more chickens. People organize baptisms, collective weddings, first communions, and confirmations on the day of that religious event. There are usually parties where people invite their whole families. Chicken is usually an essential part of the dishes. Evarista has sold up to  72 chickens on that day. 

The loans provided by VisionFund have been of great help, as they allow her the opportunity to invest in her business. For instance, she currently needs to buy 24 chickens and plastic bags that she uses to package her products. In her community, the cane cutting season is approaching and the local economy will prosper. She knows that she will have to be prepared with enough meat to satisfy her customers. "I hope to be able to sell roasted chickens, accompanied by rice and salsa every weekend during the cane cutting season". This will allow her profits and investment to increase, which will provide more stability to her business. 

Evarista will never forget the words of her daughter: "Thank you for all that you have given me" and she knows that it has not been easy, but her effort and investments have helped her maintain her business.

* The photo was taken in one of the community's river sources. Evarista is wearing a yellow blouse.

loans.use: to buy 24 chickens and plastic bags.

location.town: Tembladeras del castillo, Acatlan de Perez Figuero

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet George. He is a 40-year-old farmer who is based in the Nyamira area of Kenya popularly known for tea and banana farming. George is also a protective husband to Rael. They got married 15 years ago, and the couple has 5 children who help them out on the farm from time to time. 
George's main source of income is milk, tea and trees. He has 2 dairy cows, 3 poultry, 40 trees and he grows tea on his 1.5 acre piece of land. He is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES to purchase poultry and a water tank. He is trying to make the poultry section of his farm more productive by adding to the number of chickens on the farm. The water tank will also be very convenient in a farm that relies heavily on water for animal intake, domestic chores and irrigation.  
Your lending will enable George to acquire assets that will bring untold benefits to his family's livelihood. Income generated directly and indirectly from this investment will help him to repay the loan and meet his children's tuition expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and a water tank.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a very hard-working and responsible person. He lives in a rural area with his family. He wasn't able to finish school because of lack of tuition. Now he has started his own family and has planted a banana plantation which he works hard to maintain for high yields. He has acquired a plot of farmland through a lot of hard work and is growing maize on it.

Elisa wants to focus on his crops so that they produce a big yield for the upcoming harvest season. Therefore, he intends to use the loan to buy organic fertilizers for the banana plantation to maintain his crops, which will increase his yields. He is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity because it allows him to increase his income. Later, he will be able to become independent and dedicate himself exclusively to his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. De 24 años de edad soltera originaria del departamento de Suchitepéquez que tiene una hermosa hija de 6 años de edad y es estudiante de la escuela de su comunidad. Ella realiza un impresionante esfuerzo a pesar de su edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y dice que nunca es demasiado tarde para empezar a desarrollar y tener una visión en el futuro.

La actividad que ella dignamente a desempeñado durante 5 años es la compraventa de abarrotería en la comunidad ya que es por medio de ella puede obtener un ingreso económico para su familia y una ganancia para mejora su condición de vida.

El uso respectivo que dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotería para así tener surtida su tienda para no perder la clientela con que ella cuenta ya que para ella es de mucha importancia contar con clientela para tener ingresos y ganancias económicas.  

Los sueños de ella es que las condiciones de su familia sean las adecuadas para un futuro y es por eso que quiere compra dos molinos de nixtamal e instalarlas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Life gave Cristina the opportunity to work as a clerk at a grocery store. This was all that she had hoped for; not only an open door, but all that was waiting for her behind that door. And what she found was something that defined what she would become. She is 24 and single living in the department of Suchitepéquez. She has a beautiful 6-year-old daughter and she's a student at the local school. Despite her age, her efforts are impressive. It's never too late to find a career, and she's hardworking and has great plans for the future. She's worked at the grocery store for 5 years. This has been a great source of income for her family and an improvement in her life conditions. She plans to use of this loan to buy merchandise to stock the grocery store to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers. It is very important to her to maintain her customer base, as they are the source of her income.
Her dream for the future is to improve her family's living conditions, so she wants to buy two corn mills and install them in her community.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Suheer

texts.en:
Suheer is a 38-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Her husband is an employee in a local firm with a low income.

Two years ago, Suheer opened a sewing workshop using a room in her house to help her husband with the family expenses. 

Suheer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. This will improve her productivity and also her income.  Suheer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Shee

texts.en:
Shee is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past eight years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting (50,000 KES), she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Josphat's Group

texts.en:
Josphat is 44 years old and has 6 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed of 15 farmers within the Butere District of Kenya. 

Josphat has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. This year, Josphat also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours so his children will be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Josphat's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik is involved in manufacturing, and he takes furniture in the small garage near his house. He has 10 years of experience in this field, and it has resulted in high quality and beautiful works that Borik produces. To be able to cover current orders, Borik needs financial support. He has applied for this loan so that he can purchase additional tools and materials for furniture production. 
His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for furniture production.

loans.name: Markus Uwani

texts.en: Markus Uwani is a maize farmer and a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Markus Uwani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Isaac, Anthony and Godiya.  Before she became a Babban Gona member, Markus Uwani would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest in order to cover her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus Uwani can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Markus Uwani spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, hoping to ensure that her children are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for immediate expenses like child school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous has a quarry business in Tala town. He supplies building stones to various construction sites and he has been running this business for 20 years. He also does farming and it has been profitable. He is 57 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. 

He will use this loan to buy more tools and equipment for quarrying. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. This is his fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he successfully paid back his previous loans. 

In future, he hopes to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more tools and equipment for use in his quarry business.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 75 years old and has 10 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 5 farmers in the Butere District of Kenya. 

Wycliffe has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods.  Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Wycliffe also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Wycliffe's Group will be able to receive one solar light as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Hp Kyeshero Group

texts.fr: Kitambala est un homme d’affaires qui s’entraide avec à sa femme,  qui elle  aussi est commerçante, membre d’une plate forme «HP Kyeshero», âgé de 37 ans, père de 5 enfants dont 3 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Il est vendeur divers matériels et matériaux de construction à son domicile dans une avenue mouvementée. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Il va acheter des planches, clous, chevrons, tôles, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Il remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux  petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Kitambala is a businessman who is mutually helped by his wife, who is herself a merchant. A member of a “HP Kyeshero” platform, he is 37 years old and the father of five children, of whom three are students, and two are little kids. Kitambala is a vendor of a variety of construction supplies and equipment at his home on a busy avenue. He is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow his business. He is going to purchase some lumber, nails, roof framework, sheet metal, etc. Thus, he would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for his children. He thanks Hekima for the support it brings to small-scale entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, nails, roof frames, sheet metal, etc.

loans.name: Succès Group

texts.fr: Salamata, membre représentatif est responsable du groupe Succès. Ce groupe de 3 femmes battantes travaille avec ACFIME depuis 2011 et respecte ses engagements. Salamata est mariée , mère de 7 enfants dont 6 sont scolarisés. Son mari est boucher et elle même depuis 16 ans vend de la farine de maïs. Avec ce prêt, Salamata voudrait profiter de ses temps de récolte au Burkina pour payer 25 sacs de maïs stocker pour faire de la farine pour vendre. Le reste de l'argent servirait à faire les autres dépenses liées à son activité. le bénéfice de ses ventes lui permettra de continuer son activité et d'aider son époux dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Salamata is a member and the manager of the Succès group. These three "warrior women" have been working with ACFIME since 2011 and respect their commitments [with the organization]. 

Salimata is married and the mother of seven children, six of whom go to school. Her husband is a butcher and she has been selling corn flour for 16 years. With this loan, Salamata would like to take advantage of  the Burkina Faso harvest so that she can stock up on 25 bags of corn that she'll use to make flour.  The rest of the money will help with expenses related to her business. 

Her earnings will allow her to continue with her business and help her spouse with the family expenses.

loans.use: stock up on 25 bags of corn that she'll use to make flour.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is married and the mother of seven children, all of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees. 

For the past three years she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and creditors in her place of operation. 

Mwatime is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase fishing net for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew is a maize farmer from Burus Village in Kaduna. Before he became a member of Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mathew can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Mathew, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jemima's Group

texts.en:
Jemima, featured in the picture above, is representing her farming group formed of 10 farmers within the Butere District of Kenya. She is 47 years old, a married mother of 6 children, and she is often described as a very friendly person. 

Although Jemima has been a farmer for more than 30 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Even though she is new to the program, Jemima wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Jemima hopes to be able to send her children to school.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights, and even though Jemima decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a corn farmer from Kiyawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his corn for a low price soon after harvest to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his corn at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for a low price at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya Jaji

texts.en:
Iliya Jaji is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya Jaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya Jaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Iliya Jaji is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Los Portales Group

texts.es:
Los Portales es el nombre que decidieron dar las integrantes a su grupo al acercarse a VisionFund para solicitar un préstamo e invertirlo en sus actividades. La comunidad donde se ubica la asociación es productora de caña de azúcar, por ello, la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedica a trabajar en el campo: preparando el suelo para sembrar caña, cuidando el crecimiento de esta y cortándola en época de zafra (cosecha). Durante los 6 meses de corte, los 4 ingenios (fábricas azucareras) cercanos a la comunidad silban tres veces al día anunciando el cambio de turno de los empleados. 

Las integrantes del grupo son:
Jessica –Venta De Agua Purificada
Mirna –Venta De Comida, Videojuegos.
Ada Luz -Venta De Cosméticos Y Toper.
Teodora - Venta De Cosméticos.

Ellas han formado una familia unida por lazos de amistad, la cual les ha permitido apoyarse en momentos difíciles. Mirna, mejor conocida como "La Nena” es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada, amable, sencilla, carismática, alegre, es madre de una joven y de un adolescente. 

Mirna está casada con Daniel quien la motivó a iniciar con la venta de comida, al principio únicamente vendía los fines de semana, pero con el paso de los meses y contando con el apoyo de su familia, en su garaje abrió una fonda. Actualmente, atiende a sus clientes de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana a 9 de la noche y los estudiantes de la comunidad son quienes más llenan las mesas del pequeño restaurante. La Nena también prepara almuerzos para los hijos de sus amigas y entrega otros pedidos de comida por lo cual también recibe un poco de dinero. Su gran reto es atender a los clientes que llegan al lugar y entregar los pedidos siempre a tiempo.

Hace apenas 4 meses Mirna decidió rentar videojuegos en el mismo local, animada por su hijo invirtió sus ahorros en la compra de dos consolas, controles y juegos. Siempre innovando y en busca de mejorar, Mirna ha decidido comenzar a vender licuados por lo que quiere invertir un préstamo para comprar plátanos, fresas y chocolate en polvo. También necesita comprar más ingredientes para seguir preparando desayunos; los ingredientes que más ocupa son carne, pan, piña, mayonesa, jamón, lechuga y queso.

Con las ganancias obtenidas Mirna continuará ahorrando y reinvirtiendo en su negocio especialmente para pagar anuncios de publicidad en la radio local de la comunidad, pues aunque muchos saben de su negocio ella espera lograr que más personas disfruten de su comida. De igual manera continuará dando estudios a su hija quien tiene 16 años y a su hijo de 10, pues esta es la mejor herencia de un padre.

*La imagen se tomó en el patio trasero de la casa de Mirna quien viste de blusa a rayas.
texts.en:
'Los Portales' is the name chosen by the members of this group when they approached VisionFund to ask for a loan to invest in their activities. The community where the association is located produces sugarcane, so, most of the people there work in the fields, preparing the soil for planting cane, making sure the crops grow healthy, and cutting cane during the harvest season. During the six months of cutting, there are 4 mills (sugar factories) nearby the community that blow their whistle three times a day to announce the change of shift of their employees.

The team has 4 members:
Jessica - Sells Purified Water
Mirna - Sells Food and Video Games.
Ada Luz - Sells Cosmetics and Tupperware.
Teodora - Sells Cosmetics.

They have formed a strong family-like bond united by their friendship, which has allowed them to rely on each other during hard times. Mirna, better known as "La Nena" is a hardworking, honest, friendly, simple, charismatic, cheerful, mother of a young woman and a teenager.

Mirna is married to Daniel who encouraged her to start selling food. Initially, she sold meals only on the weekends, but over the months and with the support of her family, she opened a diner in her garage. She now serves her customers Monday through Friday from 8am to 9pm and students in the community are the most frequent customers at her small restaurant. La Nena also prepares lunch meals for her friends' children and she also takes delivery orders that bring in some more money. Her biggest challenge is to serve her customers coming into the diner and deliver her orders on time. 4 months ago, Mirna decided to expand and start renting video games out of the same location. Encouraged by her son, she invested her savings in two video consoles, joysticks and games. Always innovating and looking for improvement, Mirna decided to start selling smoothies to she wants to invest the loan to buy bananas, strawberries and chocolate powder. She also needs to buy more ingredients to continue preparing breakfast meals; the most important ingredients are meat, bread, pineapple, mayonnaise, ham, lettuce and cheese.

With her profits Mirna will continue saving and reinvesting in her business especially to pay for ads in the local community radio station, because even when many know about her business, she hopes to get more people to enjoy her food. No matter the outcome, she will continue sending her 16-year-old daughter and 10-year-old son to school, because that's the best legacy a parent can give their kids.

*The picture was taken at Mirna's house's backyard. Mirna is wearing a striped blouse.

loans.use: to buy meat, bread, pineapple, mayonnaise, ham, lettuce, cheese, bananas, strawberries and chocolate powder.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and the mother of two children, neither of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport. 

For the past 20 years she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Mwanasiti is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase fishing net for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her business

loans.name: Real

texts.en:
Real is a married mother with six children who do not attend school because they are all grown up. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are buying insecticides like duduthrin and Bulldock.
