For the past 20 years, Real has operated a dairy farming business, selling at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of opening her own kiosk. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase medicine for her livestock and cattle feed. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cattle feed

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina, aged 43, is married and lives in a small village in the Baghdati district with her husband and three children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and produce wine and vodka to sell locally. 

Irina wants to start an animal husbandry business and has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, will enable her to take out a loan of 2,000 Gel. With the received credit, she will purchase a cow and start her animal husbandry business. From the milk, Irina will produce dairy products and will sell fresh milk daily, yogurt and cheese. She will increase her family's income and will expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start an animal husbandry business

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en: Haneen is a 22-year-old single woman who lives in Al-Mafraq with four family members. Her dad is retired and has a barber shop. Haneen is in her second year of study for her bachelor's degree in accounting. Her future plan is to get her degree and work in her field. Haneen is applying for a loan to help her to pay for her university fees for next semester.

loans.use: to pay for her university fees for next semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the leaking roof of her family's house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Margdaline

texts.en:
Margdaline is a 46-year-old woman married to Stephen who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Margdaline has been operating a cereals business shop for a period of six years earning herself an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Margdaline is now servicing her fourth loan of 25,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy beans and maize grains to add to her current stock of cereals. Margdaline plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy maize grains and beans to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana  de 29 años de edad es una mujer que elabora ricos  postres y productos derivados de la harina de trigo, y que también genera otros ingresos vendiendo mercancías variadas,  como ropa calzado etc. En el año 2013, Viviana inició,  esta actividad ideaada por un aviso en el periódico que ofrecia productos de repostería, ella quedó entusiasmada en comercializarlos entre sus vecinos y posteriormente logró captar la clientela empresarial y agregar a su base de compradores actuales y potenciales la venta de mercancías a la medida de sus necesidades. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito, mientras que sus compras son de contado, lo que hace que su inversión no sea mayor, pues debe esperar a recuperar el dinero de sus cuentas por cobrar para poder satisfacer oportunamente a su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finanaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará postres deditos, accesorios y fantasia. Con esta inversión ampliará su oferta e incrementará su capital de trabajo para comprar aún mas y poder ofrecer a su clientela lo que requiere, porque su mayor desafio es tener los suficientes recursos para llevar a cabo sus sueño de prosperidad rápidamente.
texts.en:
Viviana is 29 years old. She makes delicious desserts and products from wheat flour. She also generates other income selling a variety of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, etc. In 2013 Viviana started her business, sparked by a newspaper advertisement that offered bakery items. She was enthusiastic to sell her baked goods to her neighbors and later was able to gain a business customer and expand her customer base to include selling merchandise according to her customer's needs. She makes her sales on credit, which her purchases are cash, so she doesn't make big cash payments as she needs to be sure to recover the money she is owed on credit to be able to satisfy her customers.

Today she seeks a loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy finger pastries, accessories, and cake decorations. With this investment she will have the working capital to buy even more and be able to offer her customers what they required, because her greatest challenges is to have sufficient resources to quickly achieve her dream of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy finger pastries, accessories, and cake decorations.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is the married mother of five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

For the past three years, Mwanaisha has operated a stall selling fruits and green vegetables. She has always struggled to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Therefore, she decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities to boost her business. Mwanaisha is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase sacks of fruits, tomatoes and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, tomatoes and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ubucuti Group

texts.fr:
Adidja  fait partie du groupe  Ubucuti  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 40 ans et est mariée à Ismail, un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à 21 ans tous   étudient.
 

Elle fait le commerce d'habits  et de restaurant depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son  deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'habits, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Adidja is part of the group Ubucuti and lives in Bujumbura. She is 40 years old and married to Ismail, a mechanic. Together they have five children, from 7 to 21 years old, of whom all are students. 

Adidja has been doing commerce in clothing and working in food service for ten years.

She is on her 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of clothing to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a lot of clothing to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: María Delmy

texts.es:
Maria de 44 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene cinco hijos de 17, 19, 26, 30 y 34 años de edad, solo sus dos hijas viven con ella, los demás tienen su hogar aparte. Ella estudio hasta 3º grado de educación básica, su pareja es trabaja como chofer haciendo viajes en su vehículo. Solo él y sus dos hijas viven con ella.

Maria es comerciante, tiene 5 años de administrar una tienda en la que vende artículos para la cocina, la tienda la tiene en su casa y está ubicada en una zona céntrica, sus hijas le apoyan cuando ella está ocupada. El horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm.

Con su primer préstamo con la línea Kiva compró mostradores para exhibir su producto, ahora necesita el préstamo para  comprar productos para abastecer su tienda tomando en cuenta que se acerca la temporada navideña y es cuando más vende su producto.
Maria  sueña con mantener estable su negocio e incluso sueña con mejorar sus ventas y ofrecer otro tipo de producto para abarcar a más clientes
texts.en:
Maria is 44. She has a partner and five children ages 17, 19, 26, 30 and 34. Only two of her daughters live with her. The rest have their own homes. She only finished 3rd grade. Her partner works as a driver, making trips using his own vehicle. She only lives with him and her two daughters.
Maria is a merchant. She has five years of running a store that sells kitchen supplies out of her home. She lives in a busy area, and her two daughters help her when she's really busy. She's open from 6:00am to 8:00pm.
She used her first Kiva loan to buy counters to showcase her products, and now she needs a second loan to stock her store, taking advantage of the upcoming holiday season, when she sells most of her products.
Maria dreams to keep her business stable, and she even hopes to improve her sales and provide a larger line of products to cover even more clients.

loans.use: buy products to restock her store

loans.name: Milcah's Group

texts.en:
Milcah is a 36-year-old proud mother of 2 children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of 16 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Milcah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Milcah described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to send her children to school.

With this loan, Milcah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as two solar lights.

loans.name: Arjan

texts.en: Arjan is renting from some neighbors some agricultural land and the loan he is asking from you will be used for the rental of this land.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of the land

loans.name: Twanzana Kasenyi Group

texts.en: Moses is a repeat client aged 32 years old and a member of the Twanzana Kasenyi Group. He is married with 2 children aged 5 and 3 years, and one of his children attends school at the moment. Moses does fishing as his main source of income from Kasenyi, in the Kasese district. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX (two million shillings only) to buy nets for fishing. He also has rentals where he earns income to supplement his monthly earnings. He started fishing in the year 2006 to earn income and look after his family. He is a hard working man who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. His customers are all categories of people but are primarily fish traders. His future plan is to be financially stable and educate all his children. He is faced with a challenge of limited capital for his businesses but hopes to do well after obtaining the loan money. He thanks Kiva lenders for supporting his group financially.

loans.use: to buy fish nets.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer from the village of Burus in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Dauda, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest-time

loans.name: Markus Goma

texts.en:
Markus Goma is a maize farmer from the village of Saulawa in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus Goma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus Goma can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Markus Goma, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest-time

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 40-year-old married woman from Bethlehem. She is a mother of three sons and three daughters. Two of her daughters are studying in the university with very high expenses. Her husband works in a temporary job with unstable income. Ten years ago, Afaf opened a beauty salon in the city to help her husband with the family expenses. 

Afaf took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy beauty products for hair and skin that she uses on a daily basis in her beauty salon. This will improve her business and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for hair and skin for her beauty salon

loans.name: Jose Remberto

texts.es: Jose de 36 años de edad posee una mini tienda desde hace 3 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, el vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 36 years old and has had a mini-store located in his home where he sells a variety of products such as candy, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc. He has  many customers for his good prices. He lives in his own home with his wife and son. He seeks a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale as this is his only source of income and in this way he will be able to have greater profits resulting in a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, beverages, basic grains, coffee, soup, eggs, gelatins, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 56-years-old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children who are in primary school. She sells electronics and scrap metal and has been in this business for 8 years. She also supplies water in the town of Tala. 

She will be using this loan to purchase electrical goods for sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her previous loans were paid successfully. Her future hopes are to have a big successful business and make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase electrical goods for sell.

loans.name: Turimurunani Group

texts.fr:
Alexis  fait partie du groupe  Turimurunani et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 33 ans et est marié  Odette, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 6mois à 7 ans, dont  2 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge une personne  membre de sa famille élargie. 

Il fait le commerce de la bière industrielle (Primus)  depuis  7 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de caisses de  bière industrielle (Primus) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Alexis is part of the group Turimurunani and lives in Bujumbura. He is 33 years old and married to Odette, a farmer. Together they have three children, from 6 months to 7 years old, of whom two are students. He supports a member of his extended family.

Alexis has been selling commercial beer (Primus) for seven years. 

He is on his 2nd Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase many cases of commercial beer (Primus) to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to purchase a parcel of land and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase many cases of commercial beer (Primus) to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rosa Celia continua dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia continua vendiendo comida a todos sus clientes que le solicitan como arroz con pollo, saltados, sopas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, menestras entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tejidos, comida, lubricantes de carros, ropa y otros brindan servicios profesionales.
La socia que sale adjunta a  la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Fuerza 2008” communal bank, part of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco.

Group member Rosa Celia continues to work in her restaurant business.  She still sells food to all the customers who order from her—chicken and rice, stir-fries, and soups, among other dishes.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She is thankful to the people who are part of her dream through this website and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule, since this is how she gets her family ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy oil and vegetable soup, among other items.

The other group members work selling textiles, food, car lubricants, and clothing, and others offer professional services.

The group member appearing attached to the photo asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to her work.

loans.use: to buy oil and vegetable soup, among other items.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.fr:
Aziza fait partie du groupe  Huruma et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 27 ans et est mariée à Yusufu, un garagiste. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge 5 personnes membres de sa famille élargie dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce du  riz depuis  2ans. 

Elle est à son douzième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une maison, et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Aziza is part of the group Huruma and lives in Bujumbura. She is 27 years old and married to Yusufu, a garage worker. Together they have four children, from 1 to 14 years old, of whom three are students. She supports five members of her extended family, of whom two are students.

Aziza has been doing commerce in rice for two years.

She is on her 12th Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to build a house and to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is fifty years old, married with five children, living in Kasese Uganda. Abel has operated a pork butcher shop for three years now. He began the business after sustaining a permanent injury in the army in order to earn a living. Abel has a dream of having a sustainable business and also building his dream house. However, he is faced with the challenge of competition and people over looking him thinking that disability is inability. Abel wants money to buy pigs for slaughtering.

loans.use: to buy pigs for slaughtering.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a married mother with eight children.  She lives at and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

For the past ten years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. Mbodze dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
"Elizabeth is 53 years old and has 7 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Butere District, Kenya. 

Elizabeth has been farming with One Acre Fund for several years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Elizabeth also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Elizabeth's Group will be able to receive a total of 8 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres."

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de jugos, gaseosas, agua, refrescos, desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar  de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y asi poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is 58 years old and has worked selling juice, soda, water, and other drinks for four years.  Her business is located in her home and she has many customers due to her good prices.  She lives in a house she owns with her two children.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise at wholesale so that she can continue with her sales and have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase juice, soda, water, and other drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Rigoberto De Jesus

texts.es: Rigoberto de 30 años de edad se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con sus dos hermanos y su tia en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 30 years old and has worked as a farmer planting corn and beans for 15 years.  He sells his products in the different markets near his home.  He lives with his two brothers and his aunt in a house they own.

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, pesticides, and other items, and to improve his land, which is shown in the photo, so that he can continue his work and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure, and pesticides, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 63-year-old hardworking woman who makes additional income to support her family. She and her husband Peter are blessed with two children. Norah has been a livestock farmer for five years, earning an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Norah is now taking out her fourth loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to buy an additional goat and animal feed. She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy an additional goat and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a lot of lumber to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es:
Rosa de 61 años de edad,  es soltera y tiene tres hijos de 26, 25, y 18 años de edad, solo el menos vive con ella y está estudiando, los otros dos están en el extranjero. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta 2º grado de educación básica, por lo difícil que resultaba estudiar en ese tiempo ella decidió abandonar la escuela para apoyar a su familia con trabajo. Solo su hijo vive con ella y depende de ella.

Rosa es comerciante y productora pecuaria, cría pollos de engorde, los compra pequeños, los desarrolla y luego los vende limpios listos para cocinar. A pesar de que recibe apoyo económico de sus hijos ella siempre le gustó trabajar, por lo que decidió poner su granja, la tiene en su casa y vende alrededor de 100 pollos al mes, todas las actividades relacionadas con la producción del pollo las realiza ella misma y es a ella a quien le hacen lo pedidos. Cuando no tiene pedidos  le paga a una hermana para que los venda de casa en casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 100 pollos de un día de nacidos, para desarrollarlos y tenerlos listos y a la venta para para la celebraciones de fin de año y así poder cubrir la demanda de esa fecha. Lo que más quiere Rosa es que Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando en lo que le gusta y tener siempre lo necesario en su hogar
texts.en:
Rosa is 61; she is a single mother of three children ages 26, 25 and 18. The youngest still lives with her and he is currently going to school. The other two children are studying abroad. She only finished 2nd grade. It was very difficult to go to school when she was young, so she decided to drop out and work to help her family, instead. Her son is the only one living with her and he's her only dependent.
Rosa sells and breeds chicken. She buys them small, and grows them, and then sells them clean ready for cooking. Despite receiving financial support from her children, she's always liked to work, so she decided to open a farm out of her home, and now she sells about 100 chicken a month. She takes care of all activities related to the production of the chicken and she also takes care of the orders. When she has no orders to cover, she pays one of her sisters to sell them door to door.
The loan will be used to buy 100 chicken, a day old, to develop them and get them ready and available for New Year's Eve celebrations, so she can meet the demand for that date. Rosa's biggest wish is for God to grant her a long, healthy life to keep working on what she likes to do and always have what she needs to maintain her home.

loans.use: to buy a hundred chicken

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 33-year-old single man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and also owns a pool table that yields him additional income. He faces challenges of competition. He hopes to have another pool table to increase his income. John has asked for a loan to buy a pool table to boost his business and gain more profits.

loans.use: to buy a pool table to boost his business and gain more profits.

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en: Enosi lives in Hoima Uganda. He is 43-years-old and married with five children, all of them attending school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize.  This is supplemented by a retail shop business and farming. He hopes to grow and expand his business and also educate his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits in order to keep her business well stocked.

loans.name: Edis Antonio

texts.es:
Edis de 29 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad, está estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad. Edis solo pudo estudiar hasta 5ª grado de educación básica, no pudo seguir por no contar con la capacidad económica como para mantenerse estudiando. Su pareja es ama de casa, cuida la casa y además cría aves de corral; solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

Edis es tiene una discomóvil, ameniza fiestas por contrato y tiene ya 7 años de trabajar de esta manera. A él le gustaban mucho las fiestas, pero sobre todo le llamó mucho la atención utilizar el equipo que se usa para llevar a cabo un evento por lo que decidió aprender con unos amigos y luego con un préstamo compro lo necesario para armar su propia discomóvil. Tiene tres ayudantes que viajan con él y le apoyan.

El préstamo será invertido en su negocio, necesita cy juomprar equipo para aumentar la capacidad  de su discomóvil y un juego de luces para mejorar la vistosidad de la misma, así va a ofrecer una mejor calidad de servicio y podrá abarcar otro tipo de contratos.

Edis espera le resulte de manera favorable su inversión, porque su aspiración más grande es construir su propia vivienda y darle un techo propio a su familia.
texts.en:
Edis is 29 years old, married, and has a 10 year old son who is studying in his community's school. Edis could only complete a 5th grade education, and couldn't continue as he didn't have the money to stay enrolled in school. His spouse is a housewife; she takes care of the house and also raises birds in the corral. Edis, his wife, and son live together. Edis has a disc jockey business, playing at parties for the past 7 years. He enjoyed parties, and he decided to learn from friends how to work the equipment. With the help of a loan he was able to buy what he needed to equip his own disc jockey business. He has three helpers who travel with him and support him at events.

The loan will be used in his business. He needs equipment to increase the capacity of his disc jockey equipment and a set of lights to improve the colorfulness of the show. This will result in him offering a better quality of service and be able to acquire other types of contracts.

Edis hopes that his investment will return favorable results, because his greatest aspiration is to build his own home for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment to increase the capacity of his disc jockey setup and a set of lights.

loans.name: Ruken

texts.en:
Ruken is 40 years old and a married father of 9-year-old and 7-year-old children. Ruken owns a hotel/bar/restaurant that is situated in a town in southeastern Albania and he needs this loan to finish up the place with tiles. 
The town has around 6,000 residents and was a marsh before. With volunteered contributions from hundreds of people under the communist era, it became an industrial town with lots of apartment buildings, sugar plants, alcohol plants and starch plants with the latest being the biggest plant in the Balkans. For years starting from the early 90's, all these plants not only didn’t function but they were also dilapidated. However, things changed last year with some foreign investors taking over all the plants and the surrounding lands so the construction has started again.

loans.use: to finish the bar/restaurant/hotel with tiles.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for six years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Elizabeth is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 14 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Elizabeth started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago in 2011 and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Elizabeth’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 13 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer. Before becoming a member of the Babban Gona Farmers Organization, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Yusuf is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to afford to store his maize at harvest time so he can sell it when prices are higher.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes dont leurs ambitions sont de prospérer dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu via le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide.
Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame sokhna(assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe.
Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants (02 Garçons et 06 filles). Elle tient une boutique au village ou elle vend divers produits alimentaires:riz,sucre,thé vert,et divers bouillons culinaires.Elle jouit d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquer pendant plusieurs années.

Avec ce pret,elle compte acheter 2 bidons d'huile de 20 litres et divers bouillons culinaires

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et augmenter aussi son cheptel de moutons.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of the year 2013. It is composed of women whose ambitions include prospering in their revenue-generating businesses via the 'banc villageois' programs. All the women live in the same village and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Sokhna (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of eight children (2 boys and 6 girls). She has a shop in the village where she sells a variety of grocery items: rice, sugar, green tea, and various flavorings for cooking. She enjoys good experience in this domain for having worked at it for several years. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase two 20-liter containers of oil and various culinary flavorings.

The profits from her business will enable her to save money, as well as to grow her financial capacity and to increase her herd of sheep.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts to process and obtain oil to resell at 1,000 francs per liter

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for market gardening.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 27-year-old single woman from a village near Bethlehem. She lives with her parents and six brothers and sisters in a simple house. She studied Arabic literature at a local university but could not find a job in this field. Abeer decided to start working in sewing to support her family, especially her sick brother.

Abeer took a $2,000 loan from Kiva Field Partner FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop. This will improve her productivity and also her income, and she will be able to provide health care for her brother.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like manure to improve her tea plantation.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53 years old, married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with two children. She makes beads and ornaments to sell and has been in this business for five years. She also rears chickens for sale. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more materials for making beads and ornaments to sell. She will also build more poultry houses for rearing more chickens. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making beads and ornaments.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine runs a veterinary shop whereby she sells drugs for animals in Hoima, Uganda. She is aged thirty-two years and is the single mother of three children aged between nine and five. 

Josephine dreams of expanding her business and also educating her children like any single mother. 

Josephine will use the loan facility to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Jabu

texts.en:
Jabu is a widow and mother of two children who do not attend school because they are all grown up. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are buying seeds and insecticides.

For the past 15 years, Jabu has operated a dairy farming business, selling as at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of adding more dairy cows and expanding into a motorcycle business. 

With this loan of 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase medicine for her livestock and cattle feed. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cattle feed

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en:
Catherine, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by seven farmers in Butere District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Catherine will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. Catherine plans to use the profit she gains this year to send her children to school.

In total, Catherine’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. They will also receive a total of five solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Glady's Group

texts.en:
Gladys is 50 years old and has 6 children. She has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Gladys is the only one featured in the picture above, she is actually representing her group formed of 17 farmers in the Butere District of Kenya.

Gladys started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago in 2011. She decided to do so because she wanted to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since joining. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Glady’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 8.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 14 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah, pictured above, has 6 children and is always described as a very experienced farmer, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Sarah is representing her group of 15 farmers in Butere District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Sarah has been a farmer for 17 years and, in order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Sarah is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 8.75 acres will be planted by Sarah's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 12 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Al- Hanan 5 Group

texts.en:
This borrower group is called Al- Hanan 5. It consists of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 240,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

One woman in this group is named Alia. She is 44 years old, married, and has three children. She lives with her family in their own house in a poor area. Alia has been selling perfumes and incense door-to-door for more than seven years. She works very hard in order to provide her family with necessities, but her income and capital are not enough to do that, and she does not have enough inventory to meet demand. 

Day by day, Alia's capital decreases more and more. For this reason, she applied for financial support and took out a loan of 60,000 YER in order to enlarge her business by purchasing more perfumes and incense for resale. Alia hopes to eventually open a small store for all kinds of perfumes and incense.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and incense to resell and meet customer demand

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Maureen operates a grocery vegetable selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing an open shop business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza es un grupo antiguo de 20 integrantes, donde cada una siempre tiene un espíritu de superación y de ayuda a las demás integrantes que ya forman como una gran familia.
Todas estas mujeres son ejemplo de lucha por sus emprendimientos diarios, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Marina, ella vende verduras en su carrito y de manera ambulante y actualmente ya cuenta con una casilla en su propia casa gracias a al buen manejo de sus anteriores préstamos, sumado a la buena capacitación en el manejo de sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su casilla con verduras varias y comestibles varios, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
“La Esperanza” (The Hope) is a longtime group that consists of 20 members. All of them have always possessed the drive to succeed and the willingness to help one another, so it is as if they have formed one large family.

All of these women are examples of determination when it comes to their everyday business activities. One who is worth mentioning is Sra. Marina. She sells vegetables as a street vendor from a small cart. Marina also has a booth at her house thanks to the excellent way she has managed her previous loans. With the fine training she has received, she has been able to manage her earnings.

Marina is requesting a loan so that she can restock her booth with various vegetables and food products. This will enable her to continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy various vegetables and food products to sell.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 27-year-old married father of two children. Eight years ago, he started repairing motorcycles to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Bassem is taking out a youth loan from Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development to grow his business by buying necessary motorcycle spare parts. He also wants to renovate his house to make it a healthier place for his beloved kids.

Bassem hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and renovate his house

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony is a smallholder dairy farmer based in Mweru village in the Central province of Kenya. His family consists of a lovely wife named Mary and 2 children- a 6 month old and a 7-year-old. His family is the reason why he is always fired up every morning to get out of the house and knuckle down. 
  
Antony is seeking a loan to acquire an asset that will not only make his work on the farm very easy but also enable him to transport his milk produce to distant markets with fairer prices. He is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 that he will top up with his savings to purchase an Indian motorcycle. 

Commonly referred to as Bodaboda, the Indian motorcycles are very economical and cheap to maintain. They are quickly becoming the dominant means of transportation over short distances in rural areas. Farmers use motorcycles to ferry their goods to and from the market. They also use it to do home deliveries of their produce. 

Change Antony's life by lending $25. The motorcycle is a typical villagers' dream here in Kenya.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Bousso's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes dont leurs ambitions sont de prospérer dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu via le programme des bancs villageois.

Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Bousso(assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. 
Elle est  âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfant (05 garçons et 01 fille). 

Elle  s’active dans la vente de légumes frais qu’elle se procure auprès de femmes ou de maraichers dans son village et les hameaux des environs pour la revente au marché hebdomadaire de la localité pour la revente au détail dans son village et les hameaux aux environs.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des légumes par carton pour la revente au détail et souvent par tas dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
 Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of the year 2013. It is composed of women whose ambitions include prospering in their revenue-generating businesses via the 'banc villageois' programs. All the women live in the same village and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Bousso (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a 44 years old and a married mother of six children (5 boys and 1 girl). She is active in selling fresh vegetables, which she procures from women or from market gardeners in her village and from nearby hamlets. She then resells the goods at the weekly markets in her town […]. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase vegetables by the box to sell retail, and often by the lot, at the weekly markets. 

The profits from her business will enable her to help more in covering the children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables by the box to sell, and often by the lot, at weekly markets

loans.name: Hugo Jeremías

texts.es:
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una pareja de bueyes, los necesita para realizar los trabajos de la tierra, hacer los surcos y el arado, se verá favorecido al no tener que gastar para que se los hagan e incluso podrá alquilar los suyos para realizar este tipo de trabajo.

Las aspiraciones de Hugo son tener siempre lo necesario para su familia como fruto del esfuerzo de su trabajo y tener su propio terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
The loan would be utilized to buy a pair of oxen. He needs them to be able to carry out soil work, to plow and make ridges and furrows. It would be favorable not to have to pay for the work they do and they could also be leased to carry out the same kind of work.

Hugo's aspirations are to always have what his family needs by way of the fruits of his labor and having his own land to farm.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is from a rural area in western Uganda. She is 41 years old, married and has six teenage children. Unfortunately, they are in poor schools because of the family's difficult financial situation. Harriet has been a farmer for six years.

She is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land to increase the size of her banana plantation. With her two previous loans, she was able to buy better seeds for beans and corn that increased her yields and income. Her dream is to build a permanent house and open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for farming

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en:
This borrower group consists of four hardworking and successful entrepreneurs, who have businesses that provide pastries, fish, soft drinks and eggs. 

The featured borrower is Joyce, who is 40 years old, has a husband, and is the mother of 4 children. She prepares pastries and sells them to customers. She is asking for a loan to buy more flour, baking powder, and margarine to prepare more pastries. She has been making a good profit in this business. 

Altogether, the group needs a total of 3,000 GHS to be able to serve their customers better. They have been together for many years, and this is their third loan cycle with Kiva Field Partner ID Ghana. They will hold one another responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy more flour, baking powder, and margarine to make and sell pastries

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old and married.  She and her spouse have been blessed with two children. 

Jackline trades livestock, and she has been in that business for four years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy cattle, goats, and sheep to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy household goods.

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and live a better life with her family.

loans.use: To buy cattle, goats, and sheep to sell

loans.name: Cristo Rey Group

texts.es:
Maribel es una mujer de 36 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la artesanía en plástico.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, responsable, constante, activa y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ´Miraflores´ un área residencial caracterizada por su ubicación céntrica en la ciudad, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura promedio de 4-21 grados centígrados, que varía durante el transcurso del día.
Maribel es de tez trigueña, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymará el cual sólo habla con familiares y habla español para el comercio (fila de adelante, al centro, usa chamarra negra y tiene una mano en el bolsillo). Su vida la comparte con su hermano que trabaja, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con agua potable y electricidad. La necesidad por mejorar su calidad de vida la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos, librería, venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, confección de tejidos y venta de pescado, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la artesanía en plástico como; Artesanías para días festivos (Usa una botella de plástico grande para hacer una cesta de Pascuas), "Pinceles" de botella (Convierte las botellas de plástico en sellos de flores), Artesanías para el exterior (comedero para pájaros en botella de gaseosa), etc., y también teje con bolsas de plástico; bolsos, carteras y diferentes objetos decorativos o accesorios de moda. Su negocio es innovador y casi único en el mercado, por lo que tiene clientes de tiendas dónde realiza el adornado de ambientes entre otros; ‘la ventaja de mi negocio es que viajo constantemente a ofrecer mis productos a clientes en todas partes y siempre me terminan comprando algo…’. Su sueño es consolidarse como diseñadora conocida en todo el país y desea realizar la ampliación de su negocio mediante la compra de plástico reciclado por mayor. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maribel solicita  un préstamo para la compra de plásticos reciclados por mayor para ampliar su negocio y expandir su arte.
texts.en: Maribel is 36, single, with no children. She sells crafts made out of plastic. She is business-minded, independent, responsible, reliable, active and hardworking. She works in Miraflores, a residential area characterized by its central location in the city, with cold, dry weather with average temperatures between 4-21 degrees Celsius, that vary during the day. Maribel has dark skin, with long, brown hair, medium height, her mother tongue is Aymara, her family language, but she speaks Spanish when she works (in the picture: front row, center, wears a black jacket and has a hand in her pocket). She shares her life with her brother. They live in a brick house they rent, and they have water and electricity. The need to improve her quality of life led her to form a banking community group with other business owners. They sell soft drinks, books, clothes, fruit, tomatoes, fish, and one of them makes apparel clothing. Together, they asked for a loan to expand their businesses. Maribel sells plastic crafts such are holidays items (she uses large plastic bottles to make Easter baskets), bottle vases (she turns plastic bottles into flowers vases), outdoor crafts (soda bottle birdfeeders) etc., and she also makes woven plastic items such as bags, purses and different decorative objects or fashion accessories. Her business is creative and very unique in the market, so she has clients that hire her to decorate their stores, among others. 'The good thing about my business is that I'm constantly travel to offer my products to customers everywhere and they always end up buying something...' she says. Her dream is to become known throughout the country as a designer and she wants to expand her business by purchasing recycled plastic in bulk. This is the second cycle of loans with this association in three years of doing this activity. This is the reason why Maribel is asking for a loan to buy recycled plastics wholesale to expand her business and distribute her art.

loans.use: to buy recycled plastics wholesale to expand her business and distribute her art.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Il est composé de  femmes dont leurs ambitions sont de prospérer dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu via le programme des bancs villageois. 

Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 39 et mère de 6 enfants dont 5 garçons et 01 filles. Elles s’active principalement dans l’achat et la revente de petits ruminants : moutons et chèvres qu’elle achète avec l’aide de son mari dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour la revente plus tard à un prix plus intéressant. 

Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine  pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de 5 ans.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle prévoit d’acheter 2 à 3 moutons pour un prix maximal de 25 000 Fr CFA et 4 chèvres pour 20 000 Fr CFA l’un au plus.

Les bénéfices lui serviront d’apporter un soutien à son mari dans les charges familiales d’un part et d’accroître son épargne d’autre part.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of the year 2013. It is composed of women whose ambitions include prospering in their revenue-generating businesses via the 'banc villageois' programs. All the women live in the same village and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Fatou (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. Aged 39, she a married mother of six children (5 boys and 1 girl). She is active mainly in the buying and selling of small ruminants: sheep and goats, which she purchases with he husband’s help at the weekly market in order to resell later at a better price. 

She enjoys a lot of experience in this domain for having worked at it for over five years. With this new loan, she plans on purchasing 2 to 3 sheep at a maximum price of 25,000 francs CFA; and 4 goats at 20,000 francs each at most.

The profits from her business will be used to support her husband in covering family expenses, a well as to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase 2 or 3 sheep at a maxium price of 25,000 francs CFA and 4 goats for at most 20,000 francs each.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard lives in Hoima Uganda. He is forty-eight-years old and  married with six children, three of whom attend school. He operates a retail shop mainly selling sugar, salt, cooking oil, plastic items others. He desires to expand his business and trade in wholesale. He will use the loan to buy more plastics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more plastics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a cart to prepare salchipapas (potato and meat patties) and an oven to make brochettes. She dreams of having a dining room in the future to host her clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place durant le second semestre de l’année 2013. Le banc villageois vient d’entamer son troisième cycle et on note une meilleure compréhension du programme que dans le passé.
 
Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent de bonnes relations, la solidarité et l’entre aide rythment leurs activités.

 Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.
Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. 

Elle est  âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant (03 garçons et 02 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte compléter pour achète de l’huile à 30 000 Fr CFA, deux sacs de riz à 28 800 Fr CFA et du sucre à 17 500 Fr CFA  pour la revente au détail dans son village.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer dans la scolarisation de ses enfants d’une part  et aussi d’augmenter son épargne d’autre part.
texts.en:
This group was set up during the second semester of the year 2013. The 'banc villageois' just started its third cycle and better understanding of the program is noted compared to the past. All the women live in the same village and maintain good relationships. Solidarity and mutual assistance bring a rhythm to their work. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Fatou (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. Aged 39, she a married mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). She is active in selling grocery items.

With this new loan, she plans on rounding out her funds to purchase some oil at 30,000 francs CFA; 2 sacks of rice at 28,800 francs; and some sugar at 17,500 francs to sell retail in her village. 

The profits from her business will enable her to help more in covering her children’s schooling costs, as well as to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase some oil, rice, and sugar to resell in her village

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is a very hard-working married man who deals in produce; mainly buying and selling maize and beans, among other items, in Hoima Uganda. He desires to expand his business and educate his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Julian

texts.en:
Julian is 35 years old and married, the father of three children, with the oldest being 13 and the youngest, 8.  He is a member of the ethnically vulnerable Egyptian Albanian community.

Julian re-sells thrifty items, including purses, clothing, shoes, kitchenware, and electronic items. Note that Julian is in the photo with some of the items he re-sells in the streets of Elbasan city, where he resides.

Recently his son became very sick and required surgical procedure.  Since the doctors in his city did not accept the boy in their emergency room, he was sent to the capital city.  Julian spent all his little savings to help his son. 

Sometimes in the past Julian worked as a carpenter, making furniture that he later sold off.  His wife worked in a clothing manufacture. Now they both do the selling of used items. 

Since Julian currently doesn’t have a house, he lives in his brother’s house.  There they have lots of grapevines, from which he makes the grappa drink "Raki" and sells it.  
 
Julian has built a little home for his family.  He needs to move in soon, since the brother’s family is coming back from immigration, yet his house doesn’t have any windows or doors. This is the reason he needs your financial help.

loans.use: to complete his house, which now has no doors and windows

loans.name: Lonah's Group

texts.en:
Lonah is a 49-year-old proud mother of nine children. She is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing her group of eight farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2013, Lonah has noticed that she has been able to consistently feed her family.

Lonah described her harvest as good last year, but she believes she can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. She is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because she will now be able to have light during dark hours for her children to use to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Lonah’s Group will be able to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land and to purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en:
Miriam's Group is formed by 13 farmers in Butere District and is being represented by Miriam, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children. Miriam has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Miriam isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she  joined the program in 2012. She has since noticed her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year, Miriam will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Miriam's Group will purchase a total of 10 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 6.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shehu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Shehu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, ensure that his children, Ezira, Osia, and Ashiru, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby reducing pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela finished paying her previous loan in time and now is asking for a new loan to restock her grocery store and keep growing her business. Her biggest achievement is constructing her house and her next goal is to grow her business.
texts.en: Adela finished paying her previous loan in time, and now is asking for a new loan to restock her grocery store and keep growing her business. Her biggest achievement is constructing her house and her next goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: buy more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Membre  fondateur du banc village Mme Awa est l’une des femmes les plus actives du groupement. Elle est divorcée et prend en charge ses enfants les plus petits au nombre de 05 dont 02 garçons et 03 filles. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais qu’elle achète par caisse dans les quais du sud du pays a partie sud, elle s’active aussi dans la vente de légume qu’elle achète au près de maraîchers en provenance du nord. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité pour la pratiqué pendant plus de 05 ans.

Elle compte avec son nouveau prêt, acheter par caisse au moins 150 kg de poisson frais pour la revente par kg.

Les bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille en santé, scolarité, habillement et surtout en nourriture d’une part et d’autre part augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa, a member the 'banc villageois' and the founder, is one of the more active women of the group. She is divorced and supports her youngest children, numbering five (2 boys and 3 girls). Awa has been active in selling fresh fish, which she purchases by the case at the docks in the country’s south. She is also active in selling vegetables, which she purchases from market gardeners from the north. She has a good mastery of this business for having worked at it for over five years. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase by the case at least 150 kg of fresh fish to resell by the kilo.  

The profits enable her to meet her family’s needs in terms of healthcare, schooling, clothing, and especially food, as well as to increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase at least 150 kg of fresh fish to resell by the kilo

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Fanuel is 60 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Fanuel is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group, formed by six farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Fanuel started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011.  He decided to do so because he wanted to make more farmer friends in his community. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Fanuel’s group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. Additionally, two of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Fanuel's Group

texts.en:
Fanuel is 60 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Fanuel is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by six farmers in Butere District, Kenya.

Fanuel started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to make more farmer friends in his community. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Fanuel’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. Thus, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello, world, meet John. He is a diligent, 33-year-old smallholder, a dairy farmer who is always jovial and smartly dressed. 

Three years ago, he married Josyline around the same time she delivered a bouncing baby girl. Family means the world to John. It also gave him a sense of responsibility that he applied to his daily tasks. He is determined to scale his business and make enough income to meet the needs of his family.
 
John's main income sources are milk and eggs. He has two dairy cows and 50 head of poultry, and he has also grown 25 trees on his 3.5 acre farmland. 

He is seeking a loan to purchase a third dairy cow and also to construct a cowshed that will house the cow.

The milk produced by the cow will be sold at a local market, and the money made will be used to service the loan.  John will use the increased income from the investment to buy food and meet other basic needs of his baby girl.

loans.use: to buy a cow and construct a cowshed for the cow

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is a maize farmer from Rukku village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jonathan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jonathan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Jonathan, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carlos Walberto

texts.es: Carlos de 34 años de edad posee una relojería desde hace 5 años ubicada en una zona muy transitada, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carlos vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como reloj, baterías, brazaletes, etc. y asi continuar con su tabajo.
texts.en: Carlos, age 34, has had a watch shop for 5 years, located in a highly traveled area.  With the sales he makes, he has been able to pay some of his household expenses.  Carlos lives in his own house with his wife and daughter.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more merchandise like watches, batteries, wristbands, etc., so he can continue his work.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise, such as watches, batteries, wristbands, etc.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 11 septembre 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un réel désire de prospérer dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu via le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide.

 Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.
Madame Ramatoulaye (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants (08 garçons et 01 fille). Elle est vendeuse de fruits suivant les saisons, pour se faire elle achète par carton, panier ou sac selon la nature du produit au marché central régional ou au près de producteur. Elle revend par détail dans sa commune et dans les marchés hebdomadaires environnants. Elle jouit d’une grande expérience dans ce domaine.

  Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 50 kg d’orange, 03 cartons de 25 kg de banane et autres fruits si elle en trouve dans le marché pour la revente.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de renforcer son épargner d’une part pour accroître sa capacité de financement et de soutenir son mari dans la gestion des charges liées aux frais scolaires et sanitaires de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was set up on September 11, 2013. It is composed of women who have a real desire to prosper in their revenue-generating businesses via the 'banc villageois' program. All the women live in the same village and maintain strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, and they also farm during the rainy season. 

Ms. Ramatoulaye (sitting at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of nine children (8 boys and 1 girl). She is a vendor of seasonal fruit. To do so, she purchases by the box, basket, or bag the produce at the central market of the region or from producers. She resells in her commune and at the nearby weekly markets. She enjoys a lot of experience in this domain. 

With this loan, she intends to purchase 50 kg of oranges, three 25-kg boxes of bananas, and other fruit if she finds some at the market, so as to resell them. 

The profits from her business will enable her to bolster her savings, as well as to grow her financial capacity and to support her husband in managing the costs related to schooling and healthcare for the family.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, and other fruit if she finds more of them at the market, so as to resell them

loans.name: Anida

texts.en:
Anida is 40 and has two children, who are 14 and 11 years old. She has been doing agriculture and livestock to earn a living for her family. 

Currently, she has a dairy cow and a female calf, and she sells the raw milk to one of her neighbours who then sells it to the local market in the city of Korce. Anida also plants and sells, in large quantities, dried beans, wheat and potatoes. Like almost every household in their region, she has some apple orchards and sells the apples to wholesale buyers.  

Anida is requesting a loan in an amount of 250,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) to buy a farming tractor. She plans to use the tractor in her own activity and also offer services with her husband to other villagers.

loans.use: to buy a farming tractor

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Listening to Peter referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for an Agricultural Extension Officer. Peter, from a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a wife and seven children, and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been milk, crops and personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Having farmed for such a long time, he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture; particularly the Nandi tribe (Peter's tribe), where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high, and Peter wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya, and Peter has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. Peter always says that, “to become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” 

He has planted many trees on his farm, and dairy food will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan, Peter will not only benefit from milk but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. 

Peter has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make his dream come true. Peter chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loan is low and is on a reducing basis. Peter underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo and during the training season, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. 

Through accumulated profits, Peter plans to permanently improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-aged children by paying tuition fees for them. He plans that through increased income he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a biogas digester, and hence save costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a humble farmer who goes to work on his farm every morning. He is dedicated in full to his work. This man only thinks about going forward and delivering good products. He knows that many people consume his products, and because of this, every drop of sweat that comes from his forehead is the determination that he puts in so that his products are pure and of good quality. 

He is a 41-year-old farmer from Kiplombe village, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He lives together with his wife and three children on a small piece of land where he keeps cows and grows a wide variety of crops. For ten years, his primary sources of income have been milk and horticultural produce. His biggest challenges are diseases and the shortage of farm inputs. Farmers in the area lack capital to purchase farm inputs, such as chemicals, to prevent these diseases.
