Joseph made a decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access loans that would help him improve his farming activities. Sometime this month, he applied for a loan to expand his horticulture farm. This will enable him to expand his operations to increase the overall output. The additional income from the expansion will go to his children's education. The cost of education in Kenya is increasingly becoming prohibitive to low-income communities, especially in the rural areas. As a result, kids are forced to drop out to start working to contribute their earnings to their families. With your loan, Joseph's children will acquire quality education that will act as a strong foundation for their bright future.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farming.

loans.name: Dritan

texts.en:
Dritan is 33 and a father of two children who are nine and five years old. The loan that he is requesting will be used to build an irrigation system. So far he hasn’t had one, and it has been very difficult to water the land.   He said that sometimes the water he was getting was so little, that the vegetable plants dried in the summer months. 

Dritan has been working in agriculture for some time, planting and selling beans and potatoes, and selling raw milk and other dairy products that he makes from  his dairy cows, and also selling apples from his orchards. During summer, he goes to Greece for seasonal work in the tourism industry, while his wife stays home and takes care of the children, and also helps with the agriculture and livestock activities.

loans.use: to build an irrigation system

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika de 33 años de edad, desde muy niña le gustó el comercio, pues siempre vió a su familia dedicarse a actividades comerciales y de allí surgió gran parte de su experiencia. Hace 7 años, en el año 2007, decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios, para lograr ser independiente y se dedicó a vender ropa masculina y en la línea femenina. Su negocio poco a poco fue creciendo mediante un sistema de oferta a crédito de sus productos, que se adapta a las posibilidades de compra de su clientela, quienes principalmente habitan en el sector donde se encuentra ubicada. Su meta es tener un gran almacen  y lograr una  clientela propia, pues todos sus clientes son compartidas con su familia y necesita agregar muchos mas, para impactar efectivamente sus finanzas. Su mayor desafio es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responder a los pedidos de su clientela, por eso está aplicando  a un credikiva, primer financimiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa ajustada a la temporada de navidad y de año nuevo; con esta inversión tendrá un mayor inventario que ofrecer y esto es beneicioso, para el crecimiento de su negocio, en el cual trabaja sin cesar de lunes a domingos, desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, con el fin de lograr muchos de sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Erika, who is 33 years old, always loved commerce. She always saw her family making a living through commercial activities and that led to most of her experience. Seven years ago, in 2007, she decided to undertake her own business venture in order to be able to live independently, and she began to sell men's and women's clothing.

Her business began to grow little by little through a system of offering her products on credit which adapts to her customers' possibilities of buying. Her customers mainly live in the area in which she is located. Her goal is to have a department store and attract her own clientele. Her current customers are shared with her family and she needs to add many more to have an effective impact on her finances.

Her greatest challenge is to have enough working capital to respond to the demands of her clientele. This is why she is applying for a Credikiva, the first financing that she has requested from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. With the loan, she will buy seasonal clothing for Christmas and new year. With this investment, she will have a greater inventory to offer which is beneficial for the growth of her business, which she works at non-stop Monday through Sunday, from 9 in the morning to 9 at night, with the goal of achieving many of her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for Christmas and the new year.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, el esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y asi poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: Benedicto is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He sells clothes as an ambulant vendor at the different markets that are close to his home. He has many customers because of the quality of the clothes and good prices. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more clothes for women and men in bulk so that he can continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale clothing for men and women

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas comes from Giithu location in the central area of Kenya. He makes a decent living selling milk, eggs, and  tree products. Most of his income goes to his family consisting of his wife, Cecilia and three children aged between 1 year and 11 years. He has been only farming for four years and he has managed to maximize the use of his four-acre piece of land. He keeps 3 dairy cows, 15 heads of poultry and 5 goats. He has also planted more than 280 trees on the farm.

Cosmas is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase assets that will help him work effectively and increase milk production. He is seeking a loan of  100,000 KES to purchase a power saw and construct a zero-grazing unit. 

Construction of a zero-grazing unit can be prohibitively expensive for a smallholder farmer, unless they can source locally available materials like timber. Cosmas will use the power saw to make wood that will be used for the construction of a cow shed and other furniture for sale. 

Money made from this investment will enable him to pay back the loan debt and elevate his family's livelihood. Part of the income will also enable him to pay for his children's education at a local school.

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit and buy a power saw

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, is a teacher at a local school in Gyumri town. She also provides overtime classes in a small room of her house. Mariam teaches foreign languages, and is a very proud teacher with many students.
 
To conduct her classes more effectively, Mariam asks for this loan to purchase a computer for providing individual classes to her students. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This program provides business start-up loans with manageable conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Mariam, hopes for lenders' support to be able to make her classes more effective.

loans.use: to pay for a computer for providing individual classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, among other things.

loans.name: Hajara Ayuba

texts.en:
Hajara Ayuba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hajara Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children, Kabiru and Rahama.  

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara Ayuba would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs for such items as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara Ayuba can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Hajara Ayuba  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sule Nadanko

texts.en: Sule Nadanko is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule Nadanko would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule Nadanko can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Sule Nadanko, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. Due to her husband’s unemployment here, she showed great support for him while he was taking the decision to move abroad to provide the family with funds for everyday expenditures. 

As for Fatmeh, she is a private teacher working in this profession for the past six years. She is a great tutor, and knows how to educate her students properly. With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will purchase a laptop to develop her proficiency and expertise. 

In the future, Fatmeh seeks to get hired at a local school, noting that she will persist in teaching pupils in private as well to gain superior income.

loans.use: purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja como empleada en una empresa privada, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza por esa razon solicita un credito para comprar polines, laminas y pago de mano de obra para que ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: The young woman who has had her face pixelated is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She works as a clerk in a private company. This works allows her to succeed. She lives in her own home with her husband and her son. She wants to improve their housing by changing the roof of her house but she does not earn enough. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy beams and sheeting and pay laborers so that she and her family can live with greater safety.

loans.use: to purchase beams, sheeting, and pay laborers to repair her roof

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 30 year-old smallholder farmer in the Kipsaiya location in Kenya. He is married to a homely lady called Divina. In 2009, the couple was blessed with their first and only baby boy. Edwin is a mixed-farmer who specializes mostly in dairy. 

He states that he enjoys farming because it is a noble and fulfilling profession. His major challenge is lack of capital to get crop farming going since the costs of inputs are quite prohibitive. Formal financial institutions would not finance crop cultivation because the investment is exposed to many uncertainties. 

Edwin's solution was to invest in dairy farming. He knew that once he had demonstrated regular cash flow, he would be in a better position to secure a loan. He is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs and do crop cultivation. He will use the money he is making from dairy to service the loan and later recoup when harvesting is done. 

Income from this investment will help him take his boy to school and settle education expenses.

loans.use: to grow his horticulture farm

loans.name: Alicia Alexandra

texts.es:
Alicia es una señora de 29 años, vive con su pequeño hijo en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, vive en una pequeña casa arrendada en esta bella ciudad.
Alicia es una madre muy trabajadora, en las mañanas pasa con su pequeño y a partir de las tres de la tarde ella sale a una esquina muy concurrida a vender salchipapas, saca su coche todos los días para vender sus productos. A pesar de la lluvia Alicia no deja de trabajar ya que es su único ingreso para sustentar su pequeño hogar; por ello Alicia acude a la Fundación, ya que solicita un crédito para la compra de una carpa más grande para su negocio y poder atender mejor a su clientela, también va a comprar un cilindro de gas necesario para su trabajo diario.
Se siente enormemente agradecida porque son pocas las instituciones que ayudan con pequeños créditos para poder superarse. Alicia comenta que va a salir adelante para seguir siempre trabajando con esta institución.
texts.en:
Alicia is a 29 year old woman. She lives with her young son in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados in a small rented house in this beautiful city.

Alicia is a hardworking mother. In the morning, she is with her small child. Beginning at 3 pm, she goes on a busy corner selling salchipapas [a local street food of sausages and french fries]. She takes a car everyday to sell her products. Alicia does not stop working even in the rainy season because it is the only income to support her small household. This is why Alicia went to the foundation to request a loan to purchase a larger tent for her business to better serve her clientele and a cylinder of gas necessary for her daily work.

She feels enormously grateful because few institutions provide small loans to help people succeed. Alicia says she will always try to get ahead and will continue to work with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase a larger tent to provide better service to her food stall's clients in order to get ahead alongside her little son

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Hayin Malam Yako village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a conservative woman, and she asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Hind is a married, woman who lives in Marka. They have a small store beside their house that they turned into a shop, where he sells frozen food, such as chicken, meat, vegetables, etc. 

Now, Hind is applying for a loan to help her husband to do maintenance on all the electronics in the shop and to buy a new chopping machine and a new refrigerator.

loans.use: to help her husband do maintenance on all the electronics in the shop and to buy a new chopping machine and a new refrigerator.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado y esta acompañado, es padre de un niño de 3 años de edad.

 Fidel trabaja como motorista desde hace 3 años, trabaja con sus amigos y los ratos libres le ayuda a su hermano en la venta de lácteos cerca de su casa, su compañera de vida estudia y trabaja también, su hijo lo deja al cuidado de su madre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar azúcar, frijoles, arroz, detergentes, huevos, galletas, bebidas, etc para ayudar a su hermano a surtir la tienda que posee. 

El sueño Fidel es en un futuro obtener un crédito mas grande para construir su vivienda y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fidel, 33 years old, studied until the 6th grade. He is married and is the father of a three-year-old boy.

Fidel has worked as a driver for the last three years. He works with his friends and in his free time he helps his brother sell dairy products near his home. His wife studies and also works. He leaves his son under the care of his mother.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy sugar, beans, rice, detergent, eggs, cookies, drinks, etc. to help his brother supply his store.

Fidel’s dream is in the future to have a bigger loan to build his house and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, detergent, eggs, cookies, drinks, etc. to help his brother supply his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, and deodorants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the upkeep of her crops.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is a 30-year-old married woman. She is from Lebanon and has two children. Her husband independently manages a painting business. In 2010, Faten began her own business in an attempt to receive a higher income that satisfies the family needs. 

With her loan, which she is applying for from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase tailoring tools and supplies, to become capable of serving a bigger range of clientele. Faten wishes to enhance her financial resources, and consequently, the family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring tools and supplies

loans.name: Dimas Antonio

texts.es:
Dimas es un señor de 45 años de edad, él no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar y se acompaño es padre de 2 hijos los cuales estudian quinto y segundo grado, en su casa solo viven ellos con sus hijos.

Dimas se dedica a la ganadería hace 10 años,  trabaja como empleado en este oficio pero su patrón le regalo una vaca parida y fue así como se independizo y también trabaja en la agricultura y su terreno esta cerca de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla la cual cuidara por cierto tiempo y luego la venderá y con las ganancias seguir trabajando y pagar su crédito.

El sueño de Dimas es obtener un crédito mas grande y a futuro construir unas habitaciones en su casa para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dimas is a 45 year old man.  He didn’t have the opportunity to go to school.  He entered into a long-term relationship and is the father of two children, who are in fifth and second grade.  He and his partner live in their house with their children.

Dimas has worked in cattle raising for 10 years.  He worked as an employee in this trade, but his boss gave him a calved cow, and that was how he became independent.  He also works in agriculture, and his land is close to his house.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a heifer.  He will care for it for a while, and then he will sell it.  With the profits, he will continue working and pay off his loan.

Dimas’s dream is to get a bigger loan and, in the future, build some rooms onto his house to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, which he will care for a while and then sell.  With the profits, he will keep working and pay off his loan.

loans.name: Truth Group

texts.en: Mawuko is mother of one child who is still in school. She is in her late mid-forties and is married. For 11 years now, Mawuko has been selling jewelries, cosmetics and cloth. She does business from 7 am to 5 pm every workday, and is able to make a fairly good monthly profit. This will be her eighth loan request from ID Ghana. She used the previous loans to buy more jewelries, cosmetics and cloth to resell. Mawuko has paid back the earlier loans successfully. She used her business profits to cover school fees and home food expenses and also saved in accordance with her business plan. With her new loan, she will buy more jewelries, cosmetics and cloth for her business. Mawuko dreams of making her family's life better. Mawuko will share this loan with her colleague, Lukaya. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy more jewelries, cosmetics and cloth to resell.

loans.name: Anas Mohammed

texts.en:
Anas Mohammed is a maize farmer.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Anas Mohammed would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Anas Mohammed can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Anas Mohammed  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his pineapple crops.

loans.name: Cristobal Alberto

texts.es:
El deseo de superación ha llevado a Cristobal de 31 años de edad soltero a aprender algunos actividades para el beneficio de su familia, el realiza una gran lucha por sus hijos para poder darles una condición de vida adecuada, el cuenta con dos hijos de 5 y de 2 años que aun no estudian.

La actividad que el realiza con tanto empeño es la compra y venta de papas fritas en todos los alrededores du su comunidad ya que por medio de ella puede tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia, Cristobal lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 15  años y es por medio de ello que puede tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, la segunda actividad que el realiza es la venta de frutas y la venta de granizadas para así tener un ingreso extra para el beneficio de su familia.

El uso respectivo que el dará al préstamo es para la compra de papas y insumos de papas fritas ya que para el lo son de importancia para poder realizar su trabajo para no perder la clientela con que el cuenta y solo por medio de ello el puede tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Las aspiraciones de Cristobal es ver que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales en la vida y construir casas para sus hijos tengan las condiciones de vida adecuada y la compra de un local en el centro de su comunidad para así tener mejores ventas.
texts.en:
The desire for self-improvement has led 31-year old, unmarried Cristobal to learn various activities to support his family. He makes a great effort for his children so that he’s able to give them proper living conditions. He has two children – five and two-years-old—that are not in school yet. 

The work he does with such effort is the buying and selling of fries in all of the surrounding areas of his community, which allows him to be able to have an income to benefit his family. Cristobal has been doing this job for 15 years, and it is through this that he’s able to have an income to improve his family’s living conditions. The second job he has is selling fruit and shaved ice in order to have extra income to support his family. 

The respective use of his loan is to buy potatoes and ingredients for fries since they are vital to carrying out his work and not losing customers he counts on. Only through this is he able to have an income to improve his family’s living conditions. Cristobal’s aspirations are to see that his children become professionals in life and build homes for their children so that they have proper living conditions – and to buy a shop in the downtown community to have better sales.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and ingredients for fries.

loans.name: Sabo Umar

texts.en: Sabo Umar is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sabo Umar would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sabo Umar can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Sabo Umar expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bassima

texts.en: Bassima is a 41-year-old Lebanese woman. She is married and has three children, all attending school. Seven years ago, and following the unspeakable conditions that she faced with her husband, she decided to start working on producing food at her domicile. Her goods are produced in a vigilant way, as they must be always fresh and delightful, with a pleasing and agreeable smell to please the customers. And today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase supplies needed, so she can increase her production, sales and income. Bassima seems to be very a gentle and optimistic person willing to support her family somehow or other.

loans.use: purchase supplies needed

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mujer emprendedora de 33 años de edad residente en Suchitepéquez  casada, ella tiene 3 hijos de  los cuales se dedican a estudiar en la escuela de la comunidad donde viven,  ella tiene que realizar un esfuerzo enorme para poder mantener a su familia y ver la forma de cómo mejorar el sistema económica de ello.

El actividad que realiza es la fabricación de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas y los pone a la venta en la comunidad donde ella vive ya que para ella es una fuente importante de ingreso para su familia, para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida que actualmente viven  en su comunidad, ella realiza una segunda actividad que es la venta de refacciones, ella siempre trata la forma de cómo tener un ingreso económico extra para poder darle a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen y que algún día llega a ser un profesional en la vida.

El uso respectivo que le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de hilos para la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas para luego venderlas en su comunidad y vecinos para tener un mejor ingreso económico  para ella y su familia.

Una de sus metas futuras es la compra de un local en su comunidad para que ella pueda realizar la venta de su mercadería y ver crecer a sus hijos en la escuela y llegar a ser  profesionales en la vida y que tenga una condición de vida mejor.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 33 year-old, enterprising woman who lives in Suchitepéquez.  She is married, and has 3 children who study in the local school.  She has to make a huge effort to support her family and see how she can improve their financial situation.

She has a business making güipiles (traditional embroidered blouses), and traditional style skirts and belts.  She puts these on sale in the community where she lives, because for her this is an important source of income for her family so that she can improve their current living conditions.  She also has a business selling spare parts.  She always tries to have a source of extra income in order to give her children the education that they deserve so that they can become professionals in life. 

This borrower will use this loan to buy thread to make traditional clothing to sell in her community and to neighbors.  This way, she can have more income for herself and her family.

One of her future goals is to buy a store in her community where she could sell her merchandise.  This way they could have better living conditions, and she could see her children grow in school and become professionals in life.

loans.use: to buy thread to make traditional embroidered blouses, skirts, and belts

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Suchitepéquez es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 4 años Herminia de 27 años, quien vive en su comunidad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 3 hijos por quienes lucha cada día ellos estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de marranos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de maíz por los terrenos con que ella cuenta.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de un lote de terreno para tener más espacios en la crianza de más animales para que a ella le genere más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de cerdos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal.
texts.en:
One of the characteristic businesses of Suchitepéquez is raising animals of all types.  For 4 years, 27-year-old Herminia, who lives in her community, has worked raising pigs.  This business generates satisfactory profits to benefit her family and to improve the living conditions of her children.  She has three children, whom she fights for every day.  They attend school, which is close to their community.

Herminia works selling pigs in the community where she lives.  This produces good profits because she doesn’t have competition in that business, and it helps her improve her living conditions and those of her family.  She also works sowing corn in the land she owns.

She is making a loan request to buy a plot of land to have more space for raising more animals.  That way, she can generate more profit, be able to improve her family’s living conditions, and support the development of her community for the future.

Her goals are to generate more income, to sustain her family, to continue raising pigs, and to buy a corn mill.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 40-year-old Lebanese married woman with three children. Her husband operates a barber shop, and she works in cooperation with him as a tailor since three years ago. Mona serves her clients in a very professional way to ensure her customers' satisfaction and coming back at the same time. And presently, Mona wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase tailoring tools and supplies. Mona is convinced and persuaded that this Kiva loan will change her living by adding both financials and morals values into her life.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring tools and supplies

loans.name: Alya

texts.en:
Alya is a twenty-year-old married woman with one child. She is from Lebanon and lives with her husband. She was married and started working at a young age.

Alya farms in a small area next to her house. She is applying for a 810,000 LBP youth loan through Vitas. s.a.l., which she will use to buy seeds and fertilizer. This expenditure will help her improve her farming in terms of production efficiency and yield.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sule

texts.en: Sule is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Sule joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Peace, Zainab and Abas.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Sule  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He eventually hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino de 68 años de edad es soltero, no estudio por apoyar a su familia con trabajo y contribuir a los gastos de la casa, su familia solo la conforman sus hijos, que le apoyan en los trabajos agrícolas. Todos los días Cristino se levanta a las 5:30 am para ordeñar su ganado para vender la leche, después se va a trabajar al campo con sus hijos en la parcela que ha alquilado y por las tardes cuida sus animales.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una novilla que espera posteriormente se convierta en una productora más de leche que va a favorecer su negocio. Cristino aspira reparar el techo de su casa con ayuda de CrediCampo.
texts.en: Cristino is 68 years old and is single. He did not go to school because he had to work and contribute to his family's living expenses. His family is made up of only his children, who help him with his agricultural work. Cristino gets up every day at 5:30 am to milk his cows in order to sell the milk. He then goes to work in the field with his children on the lot that he rents. In the afternoons he looks after his animals. The loan will be used to buy a heifer that will later become another milk producer and improve his business. Cristino would like to repair the roof of his house, with the help of CrediCampo.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Dauda, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José de 64 años de edad, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa y le apoya en el cuido del ganado, él solo estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica por falta de recursos económico tuvo que abandonar la escuela. Solo su esposa vive con él.

José es agricultor y productor ganadero, todos los días se levanta a las 4:00 am para ir a trabajar en la parcela que alquila, es apoyado por sus hijos que ya tienen su propio hogar, luego por las tardes ordeña su ganado.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar dos vacas productoras de leche, para mejorar la producción de su casa y aumentar la venta de leche de la que es encargada su esposa. José tiene pensado construir una galera donde resguardar a sus animales en época lluviosa para evitar que se enfermen por estar expuestos.
texts.en: Jose is 64 years old and is married. His wife is a homemaker, and helps him in caring for his cows. He only went to school as far as the 9th grade, when he had to  leave due to a lack of financial resources. Only his wife lives with him. Jose is a farmer and milk producer. He gets up every day at 4:00 am to go to work on the lot that he rents. His children, who now have their own homes, help him with this work. In the afternoons he milks his cows. The loan will be used to buy two cows for milk production, in order to improve his production and increase the amount of milk sold. His wife is in charge of selling the milk. Jose is thinking of building a shed to shelter his animals when it rains, so that they will not get sick from exposure.

loans.use: to buy two cows for milk production.

loans.name: Rober Antonio

texts.es:
Rober un joven de tan solo 29 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, quiere pagarse sus estudios con el sudor de su frente, siempre ha querido estudiar producción agropecuaria y por ello comenzó con su negocio de cría de cerdos, una profesión común en su ciudad, donde no solo destaca el precio si no la calidad de los cerdos. 

Rober solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales para la construcción de un pozo séptico con el cual podrá mejorar la condición de sus cerdos.

Uno de sus grandes sueños es poder sostener su negocio y además también poder comprar su propia vivienda.

Mejora la vida de este colombiano con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Rober, a young man of only 29, is full of dreams and aspirations for his life. He wants to pay for his education with the sweat of his brow. He has always wanted to study agricultural production, and for that reason he began with his business of raising pigs, a common profession in his city, where not only the price but also the quality of the pigs stands out.

Rober is applying for a loan to purchase materials for the construction of a septic system, with which he will be able to improve the conditions of his pigs.

One of his great dreams is to be able to sustain his business and, in addition, to also be able to buy his own house.

Improve the life of this Colombian with a loan!

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a septic system

loans.name: Rufiji Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is a single woman and a mother of two kids, is aged 30s. Her kids are at school. For five years now, she has been managing a business selling charcoal and firewood. She is able to order a half lorry of firewood and 26 sacks of charcoal and is able to make a good profit each month. Rehema works from 6 a.m. to midnight daily.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second credit request to be apportioned to Rufiji, a group with three members. She manages to repay her previous loan successfully. Rehema used the previous credit to buy sacks of charcoal and firewood as she planed. Her business now starts to gain and she believes after some period, she will be able to manage big stocks. She received an extra income which she used to cover school fees and part of home expenses. 

Rufiji’s members will held accountable for paying back the loan. Rehema will use this credit to buy stocks for her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael  habita con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años al sur de la ciudad, donde se dedica al a ofrecer servicio de transporte escolar, desde hace 15 años cuando trabajaba para un familiar suyo y este decidió no continuar, quedándole a Rafael la oportunidad de ofrecerlo aprovechando esta oportunidad. Hoy cuenta con varios vehículos y enfoca su estrategia dirigiendo información promocional directamente a los directores de las instituciones públicas.  Los padres de familia pagan a Rafael a crédito, mes vencido, y trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 am y desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 7 de la noche, transportando niños y jóvenes de la primaria y del bachillerato. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará repuestos para hacer mantenimiento y reparación a sus busetas. Con esta inversión su vehículo transportará con más seguridad a los estudiantes y el servicio incrementaría su calidad.
texts.en:
Rafael lives with his wife and their two children, ages 2 and 7, in the southern part of the city. There he makes a living as a school bus driver. He has been in this line of work for the last 15 years, after one of his relatives decided to quit, leaving the position open for him. Today, Rafael has various vehicles and focuses his marketing strategy on direct promotion with the directors of public schools. 

Families pay Rafael on credit each month. Rafael works from 6 a.m. to 9 a.m. each morning then from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. in the evening driving children and teenagers to elementary and high school. Rafael is applying for his first loan through Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It will help him to buy spare auto parts so that he can do maintenance and repairs on his buses. With this investment, his vehicles will work more safely for the students and his service quality will improve.

loans.use: to buy spare parts so he can do maintenance and repairs on his buses.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a Babban Gona Farmers Organization maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdu would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abdu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children, Abdulbariu, Usman and Yakubu, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alh. Hafisu

texts.en: Alh. Hafisu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Alh. Hafisu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Fesal, Adulhakim and Habubakar.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Hafisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Hafisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alh. Hafisu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Before his membership he would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest for the income needed to meet his family’s needs. With this 21,078 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest.

When asked about his goals, Nuhu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and in the long run make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to store his maize crop so he can sell it several months later and make a much greater profit.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en: Garba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Garba would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Garba can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Garba expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and, in the long run, ensure other members  of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer from the village of Kadanya Biyar in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Aliyu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Colirios Group

texts.es: Colirio está integrado por cuatro mujeres laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Patricia de los Ángeles que tiene la edad de 22 años, soltera y propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulsó hace dos años de sus ahorros. Este el sexto ciclo que trabaja con los financiamiento de ADIM su mayor logro es que ha diversificado los productos ofrecidos, por lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos, ya que desea invertir en arroz, aceite, azúcar, pan, sopa maggui, chiverías, etc. El resto de las integrante son Lizbeth una mujer de 44años de edad y propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace nueve años, Patricia del Carmen de 39 años de edad quien elabora piñatas y flores, y Rosa una joven de 25 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace un año.
texts.en:
Colirio is a group made up of four hardworking women, and is coordinated by Patricia de los Angeles who is 22 years old, single and owns a small grocery store in her home. She started this business two years ago from her savings. This is her sixth cycle with ADIM, and Patricia's biggest achievement is having diversified the products she offers. This has motivated her to continue requesting loans, since she wants to invest in rice, oil, sugar, bread, Maggi soup, dairy products, etc.

The rest of the group is made up of Lizbeth, 44, who has run a grocery store in her home for 9 years; Patricia del Carmen, 39, who makes piñatas and flowers; and Rosa, 25, who has owned a grocery store for one year.

loans.use: to buy basic grains in order to diversify the products she offers.

loans.name: Emmanuel Sarki

texts.en:
Emmanuel Sarki is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined primarily to create a better future for his children Dauda, Yusuf and Alsa.

Before Emmanuel Sarki joined Babban Gona he would have had to sell his maize at a low price soon after harvest for the income needed to meet his family’s needs. With this 21,078 NGN loan and Babban Gona’s support he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Emmanuel Sarki spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children in the hopes of ensuring they are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to store his maize at harvest time so he can sell it a few months later for up to 40% more in profits.

loans.name: Noelia De Jesus

texts.es:
Noelia de 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 20 años de edad, ella es profesora y tiene la vocación de enseñar gracias a que sus padres también fueron profesores, su esposo también es profesor. 

Todos los días se levanta a la 4:30 am y recorre una gran distancia en autobús para llegar a  su lugar de trabajo, el préstamo lo necesita para comprar un vehículo para movilizarse a su trabajo, siempre tiene dificultad con el trasporte y le gustaría llegar más temprano a la casa para compartir con su familia. Noelia espera cancelar su préstamo y trabajar sin tener deudas.
texts.en:
Noelia, age 39, is married and has two children, ages 10 and 20.  She is a teacher, and she has the vocation of teaching thanks to the fact that her parents were also teachers, as is her husband.

She gets up every day at 4:30 am and travels a great distance by bus to arrive at her workplace.  She needs the loan to buy a vehicle to transport herself to work.  She always has difficulty with transportation, and she would like to get home earlier to spend time with her family.  Noelia hopes to pay off her loan and work without debt.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport herself to work.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 25 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, vive únicamente con sus hijos. 
Rosa tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y a la venta de granos básicos que produce y compra en los alrededores de su comunidad, aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaron a estas actividades durante toda su vida. Tiene un puesto en el mercado de la ciudad, por lo que tiene que levantarse a las 4:00 am para llegar temprano y comenzar su venta.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz y frijol para abastecer su negocio y tener reserva para la venta. Rosa aspira a tener un puesto formal en el mercado, por el momento se ubica en la calle y en época lluviosa se le dificulta mucho mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48, she is single and has two children ages 20 and 25. She studied up to 9th grade of basic education, she lives with her children.  Rosa has been working in agriculture for several years and sells basic grains that she produces and buys in the surrounding areas of her community.  She learned this activity from her parents who have worked in this activities all their lives. She has a stand in the city market, for which she has to get up at 4:00 am and arrive early to start selling.
The loan will be used to buy corn and beans to stock her business and have some reserves for sale.  Rosa aspires to have a formal stand in the market, for now she is located in the street and during rain season it's difficult for her to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer from the village of Zaki in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Markus can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Markus, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Lilian, aged 41, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school and the third is still a baby. She also looks after her relative's child. Since 2004, Lilian has been running a genge (food stall) selling fruits and vegetables, a business she learned from her friend. She starts working at 7:30 am and works to 9:00 pm each working day with the ability to make a fair profit. 

This is her first credit from Tujijenge Tanzania which will be apportioned among the five-member Mt Ulunguru group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Lilian will use her credit to buy fruits and vegetables to sell from her genge. In the coming years, she would like to expand her genge and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell from her genge (food stall).

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 28 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo de tres años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, al no tener la capacidad económica para seguir estudiando su familia no pudo darle el estudio.  Su pareja es ama de casa y solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

José es empleado de una empresa eléctrica, tiene 3 años de trabajar, viaja cerca de 5 kilómetros en su motocicleta para llegar, su horario es de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm. También es agricultor, cultiva hortalizas aprendió gracias a su padre y es apoyado por su esposa, esto genera buenas ganancias y además tiene cosecha para consumo familiar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar semilla, fertilizante, pesticidas, herbicidas, pagar mano de obra y la preparación del terreno para llevar a cabo la siembra.

Entre las aspiraciones de José está seguir estudiando hasta terminar una carrera universitaria con su esposa, conseguir un mejor empleo, mejorar su casa, conseguir un vehículo que le facilite el trabajo con los cultivos y aumentar el área de siembra.
texts.en: Jose is 28 years old, is married, and has a three-year-old son. He went to school as far as the 3rd grade, but then could not continue because his family did not have the financial resources to support his schooling. His spouse is a homemaker, and only she and their son live with him. Jose has worked for 3 years at an electrical company. He travels for 5 kilometers on his motorcycle to get to work, and works from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm. He is also a farmer. He grows vegetables, a job which he learned to do from is father. His wife helps him with this work. This activity earns good income, and provides food for his family. The loan will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor and for preparing the soil for planting. One of Jose's goals is to continue studying, along with his wife, to complete a university degree. He would then like to get a better job, improve his house, and buy a vehicle, which will make his work in the fields easier and allow him to plant a larger area.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides, and to pay for labor and for preparing the soil for planting.

loans.name: Vale La Pena Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Vale la pena, lo integran cuatro mujeres que luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, la coordinadora es Aracely una joven esforzada de 23 años de edad, acompañada, que comercializa perecederos en el mercado de la municipalidad desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cajilla de tomate, maya de chiltoma y cebolla, y saco de yuca. El resto de los integrantes son la señora Cándida quien tiene la edad de 57 años y comercializa productos varios en su comunidad como es pescado y cajetas desde hace más de 30 años, Cecilia una mujer de 35 años dedicada a la crianza de pollo en su domicilio desde hace siete años, y Mayela una joven de 19 años de edad comerciante de perecederos en el mercado de la municipalidad.
texts.en:
The group Vale la Pena ["It's worth the effort"] is made up of four women fighting for the wellbeing of their families. Aracely, 23, is the coordinator of the group. She is married and has been selling perishables in the town market for 10 years. She will use the loan to buy a crate of tomatoes, bags of sweet peppers and onions, and a sack of yucca.

The other members of the group are Candida, 57, who has been selling products like fish and caramels in her community for more than 30 years; Cecelia, 35, who has been raising chickens at home for seven years; and Mayela, 19, who sells perishables in the town market.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Rabiu

texts.en: Rabiu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabiu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yusuf, Samaila and Nazira.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Rabiu can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rabiu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. Eventually he hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jatro and Victor.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Daniel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food, clothing, including school uniforms, as well as school fees. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Daniel  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest-time.

loans.name: Musa Kalle

texts.en: Musa Kalle is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa Kalle would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Musa Kalle can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Musa Kalle is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Danlami

texts.en:
Danlami is a maize farmer from the village of Gwanki in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danlami would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danlami can now store his maize at harvest-time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Danlami, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest-time

loans.name: Tanimu Umar

texts.en: Tanimu Umar is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Tanimu Umar would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Tanimu Umar can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Tanimu Umar expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home. In the long run, Tanimu Umar would like to ensure his children: Ashafa, Surajo and Umar, are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Gloria Gilma

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer soltera de 49 años de edad, sin hijos ni una persona que lo apoye, con lo único que cuenta es con un negocio de venta de comida donde genera todos los recursos para pagar sus cuentas y traer la comida a la mesa.
Su negocio de venta de comidas.
Gloria es una mujer soñadora sabe que es pobre pero eso no es impedimento para soñar con comprar su casa propia, cada día con cada cliente alimenta este sueño y ahora necesita de la ayuda y del corazón de personas que quieran apoyarla prestándole un capital para la compra de una sombrilla pues las fuertes lluvias afectan sus ventas, comprara sillas, y surtido en alimentos para su negocio. 
Este crédito le permitirá aumentar el número de clientes pues tendrá un lugar para atenderlos y que estos se refugien de los aguaceros comprándole un exquisito café con un delicioso aperitivo
texts.en:
Gloria is a single woman of 49, without children or other people to support her. The only thing she has is a business of selling food, where she generates all the resources to pay her bills and to bring food to the table. 

Her business is selling food.

Gloria is a dreamer. She knows that she is poor, but this is not an impediment to dreaming about buying her own house. Every day, with every customer, feeds this dream, and now she needs the help and the heart of people who want to support her by lending her the capital for the purchase of an umbrella, since the heavy rains affect her sales. She will [also] buy chairs and a stock of food for her business.

This loan will allow her to increase the number of customers, since she will have a place to serve them, and they can shelter from the downpours while buying an exquisite cup of coffee with a delicious appetizer.

loans.use: to buy an umbrella and chairs and a stock of food for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a washstand with water storage and buy a plastic tank so she can store more water and improve hygiene in her home.

loans.name: Marío Roberto

texts.es:
Mario de 63 años de edad está casado, ninguno de sus hijos vive con él, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus nietos de 10 y 15 años de edad viven con él.

Mario es agricultor y productor ganadero, aprendió trabajando con sus padres desde muy pequeño. Es apoyado por sus nietos y su esposa le cuida los animales. Necesita el préstamo para comprar un toro que le venden a buen precio y quiere aprovechar la oferta, además quiere cosechar el frijol y el maíz que sembró.

Mario espera que con la venta del toro y de la cosecha trabajar sin deudas en el futuro.
texts.en: Mario is 63 years old and is married. None of his children still live with him. He went to school as far as the 9th grade. His wife is a homemaker, and only she and his grandchildren, who are 10 and 15, live with him. Mario is a farmer and cattle producer, which are activities that he learned from his parents at a very young age. His grandchildren help him with his work, and his wife looks after the animals. He needs a loan to buy a bull which is being sold at a good price, so he wants to take advantage of the offer. He would also like to harvest the beans and corn that he planted.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a maize farmer from Dutse village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Filadelfia Group

texts.es: Giovanna de 33 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Esta es la Alcancía Comunal “Filadelfia” conformada por 06 mujeres unidas y  solidarias. Giovanna se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y cosméticos. De igual manera como actividad secundaria se desempeña como ama de casa. Gracias a su dedicación puede darles una mejor educación a sus menores hijos. El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de shampoo, desodorantes, colonias y perfumes. El grupo “Filadelfia” agradecen el crédito brindado a los inversionistas Kiva. Giovanna es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo de color morado.
texts.en:
This is the "Filadelfia" Communal Bank, composed of 6 women, united in solidarity. Giovanna is 33 years old, separated and has 2 dependent children. She is the second from the right in the purple tee shirt.  

Giovanna works selling beauty products and cosmetics. As a secondary activity, she also works as a housekeeper. Thanks to her dedication, she is able to provide her minor children with a better education. 

The loan requested by will be used to buy shampoo, deodorants, colognes and perfumes. The "Filadelfia" group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, deodorants, colognes and perfumes.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a maize farmer from Dogon Awo village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Yusuf, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Salma is in her mid twenties. She is married, and has two children, one is young, and the other is in school. She has had a business selling clothes; fabrics and sarongs, for five years. Salma works from 9 am to 6 pm daily, and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Salma is from Tujijenge, Tanzania. This is her second credit request, to be apportioned between the two members of her group, Wazo Tegeta. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to increase her capital and to buy more stock. With the small profit she received, she managed to cover school fees and household expenses.  Salma dreams of building a house for her family. 

Salma will use this loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Yunana

texts.en: Yunana is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yunana would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yunana can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yunana expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Spencer

texts.en: Spencer lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 42 years old and responsible for taking care of three children who attend school. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling maize, beans, and rice. This is supplemented by farming income. He hopes to expand and grow his business and to own a big store that supplies the whole town. Spencer will use the loan facility to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize.

loans.name: Pebe Asabe

When asked, Pebe Asabe  spoke of her  ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees and uniforms and eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sadio's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  a été mise en place le 11 septembre 2013. Il est composé de  femmes qui ont un réel désire de prospérer dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu via le programme des bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des relations solides de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et elles font aussi de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Sadio (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 45 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfant (02 garçons et 05 filles). Elle  s’active dans la vente de prêt à porter pour entant et chaussure de fabrication locale. Elle achète sa marchandise dans un grand marché de la sous région en gros et demi gros pour la revente par pièce et détail au marché de sa commune et les villages environs. 
 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter exclusivement des chaussures pour enfant au total plus de 350 pairs pour la revente par pièce.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group has been created on September 11, 2013. It is composed of women who have a strong desire to attain success in their business thanks to the banc villageois programs. They all live in the same village and maintain ties of solidarity and mutual help. They mainly work as vendors and also do farming on rainfed land.

Mrs. Sadio (the one seated on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is 45 years, married and has seven children (two sons and five daughters). She sells local brands of ready-to-wear clothing for children as well as shoes. She buys her merchandise at a big market in her region wholesale and semi-wholesale in order to resell retail at her local community market and in the nearby villages.

With this loan, she plans to buy exclusively shoes for children, at least 350 pairs, for individual retail.
The revenue from her loan will enable her to make a larger contribution towards the education costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy at least 350 pairs of children's shoes in order to sell them individually.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es: Berta de 58 años, se dedica al alquiler de sillas y mesones para fiesta, los últimos meses del año, el potencial de sus ventas se incrementan , porque las celebraciones de grados, matrimonios, primeras comuniones y las familiares  fiestas de navidades y año nuevo, así lo requieren; por ello  su clientela es mayor y su capacidad de respuesta no es suficiente para satisfacerla. Usualmente sus inversiones ocurren antes de que finalice el año y esta es la razón por la cual está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la a Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  sillas y mesones, así la oportunidad de alquilar estos enseres es mayor y mejorarán sus ingresos. Berta tiene su negocio hace 15 años, aun recuerda cuando inició en el año 1999, después de aprender el arte de decorar interiores y observar la gran demanda y la poca oferta de este servicio, que  hasta para capacitarse las academias lo requerían, Atenta a esta circunstancia acudió a su cónyuge, quien le dio el capital semilla para iniciar. En la actualidad su negocio está muy cotizado y es reconocido por los alrededores donde habita y de donde provienen las solicitudes de servicio, últimamente agregó a su servicio el alquiler de maquinas para lavar para aumentar sus oportunidades de ingresos y asi es que hoy cuenta con 5 lavadoras para ello.  Su meta mas adelante ,es hacer  su casa de dos pisos , para independizar su negocio de su vida familiar y aumentar el sosiego tan anhelado por ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Berta, who is 58 years old, rents chairs and tables for parties. Her potential sales increase during the last months of the year, because the celebrations of school promotions, marriages, first communions, and family parties for Christmas and New Year's thus need them. For that reason, her clientele is greater and her capacity to respond isn't sufficient to satisfy them. Usually her investments occur before the year ends, and that is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy chairs and tables. Thus the opportunity to rent these furnishings is greater, and they will improve her income.

Berta has had her business for 15  years. She still remembers when she started it in the year 1999, after learning the art of interior decorating and observing the great demand and the little offering of this service, which even the academies require for training. Alert to this circumstance, she turned to her husband, who gave her the seed capital to begin. Now her business is very well used, and it is known around the area where she lives, from which her requests for service come. Lately she added to her service the rental of washing machines, to increase her opportunities for income, and thus it is that now she has five washing machines for this. Her goal for the future is to make her house a two-story house, in order to make her business independent of her family life and increase the tranquility so much desired by her and her family.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to rent.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 26 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is single and is the breadwinner of their family. She cooks puto, pancake, and other kinds of bread in their house. She has had this business for ten years and would like to build a small bakery house.  As a result, she is requesting a loan to pay for labor, building materials (cement), and ingredients to make different kinds of bread.  This will help to sell to sustain the demand of her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Emily wants to build her own home for preparation.

loans.use: to pay for labor, building materials and ingredients for her bread.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yakubu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Nasara, Abigirl and Saminu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yakubu  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Gwangwamawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Danjuma

texts.en: Danjuma is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Danjuma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Danjuma can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Danjuma is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and hopes to ensure his children, Umaru, Murtala, and Ayuba, are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en: Leatu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Leatu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Magaji, Ladi and Joshua. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Leatu would have had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest to cater to her immediate cash needs to purchase items such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Leatu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Leatu spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay for school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices during harvest.

loans.name: Ishaku Ibrahim
